message.subject: TOMORROW: Advance Polls
message.text:
Michael, advance polls open tomorrow.
This is finally it, time to vote!
DO YOU KNOW WHEN, WHERE, AND HOW YOU’RE VOTING?
We have put together a handy tool that lets you map out your vote - it's the easiest thing you'll do all day.
MAKE A PLAN TO VOTE, AND THEN SHARE THIS TOOL WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY. [1]
Green candidates will win on election day, but only if every Green supporter makes it out to vote.
MAKE YOUR PLAN TO VOTE TODAY: GREENPARTY.CA/MAKE-A-PLAN [1]
Cheers,
Kyle
KYLE TATE DIGITAL DIRECTOR Green Party of Canada
P.S. Before you vote, make sure you have the proper identification.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: you can do this amazing thing right now:
message.text:
Michael --
ADVANCE POLLS ARE OPEN!
HAVE YOU MADE YOUR PLAN TO VOTE? [1]
I'm going to go today after work.
WE HAVE PUT TOGETHER A HANDY TOOL THAT LETS YOU MAP OUT YOUR VOTE – IT’S THE EASIEST THING YOU’LL DO ALL DAY. [1]
Make a plan to vote, and then share this tool with your friends and family.
Make your plan to vote right now: GREENPARTY.CA/MAKE-A-PLAN [1]
Happy voting,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN EXECUTIVE DEPUTY DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Before you vote, make sure you have the proper identification.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: 4 hours at 375
message.text:
Michael --
I just put Thanksgiving dinner into the oven, which means I have a few hours to kill.
I AM GOING TO HEAD OUT AND VOTE IN THE ADVANCE POLLS.
You can too -- advance polls are open today and tomorrow from noon to 8:00 pm.
WE HAVE PUT TOGETHER A HANDY TOOL THAT LETS YOU MAP OUT YOUR VOTE – IT’S THE EASIEST THING YOU’LL DO ALL DAY. [1]
Make a plan to vote, and then share this tool with your friends and family.
Green candidates will win on election day, but only if every Green supporter makes it out to vote.
FIND YOUR POLLING STATION, AND GO VOTE! [1]
Here is the link: GREENPARTY.CA/MAKE-A-PLAN [1]
Happy Thanksgiving,
Paul
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Before you vote, make sure you have the proper identification.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: can you check?
message.text:
Michael, it's my job to crunch the fundraising numbers every night.
I'm just going over the election period records and I don't see your name. Here's where you stand with just a few days to go before election day:
SUPPORTER EMAIL: greenparty@mikesmit.com
ELECTION PERIOD DONOR: PENDING**
SUGGESTED ACTION: MAKE YOUR ELECTION DONATION OF $ BEFORE IT'S TOO LATE. [1]
HELP GREEN CANDIDATES WIN ON OCTOBER 19 – CONTRIBUTE TODAY.
Here's the link: GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Christian
Christian Hill Data Analyst Green Party of Canada
**IF YOU RECENTLY DONATED AND IT'S NOT REFLECTED IN THIS RECORD, DON’T WORRY, WITH SO MUCH SUPPORT POURING IN WE MAY BE A DAY OR TWO BEHIND IN PROCESSING YOUR DONATION. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT.
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: not a lot
message.text:
Michael --
We have 5 days left to elect more Green MPs.
THAT IS NOT A LOT OF TIME.
Donate today to ensure that on October 19th we are celebrating Green victories.
[1]
Here is the link: greenparty.ca/donate [1]
Thanks for your support,
Paul
Paul Noble Deputy National Campaign Manager Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Michael I’m asking this:
message.text:
Michael, thanks to the hard work of thousands of grassroots supporters like you, we have come so far in the last four years. With only a weekend left until election night, we need to make one final push.
Michael, I am asking you to step up today by donating $20.
Our deadline is 11:59 PM tonight. We have one final weekend to give it everything we've got -- on television, on the radio, on the doorsteps.
This is your last chance to donate and make the 2015 election the one that changes Canadian politics for good.
Here is the link: GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
PS If you would like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447, from 7am - midnight ET. If you have trouble getting through, please try again!
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: are you ready?
message.text:
Michael --
Tomorrow's Election Day.
DO YOU KNOW WHEN, WHERE, AND HOW YOU’LL BE VOTING? [1]
We have a helpful tool that lets you map out your vote - it's quick and easy.
MAKE A PLAN TO VOTE RIGHT NOW. [1]
This election is too important to leave to chance. Planning your vote is the best way to make sure nothing gets in the way.
Plan your vote today: GREENPARTY.CA/MAKE-A-PLAN [1]
Thanks,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: vote today
message.text:
Michael --
THIS IS IT! TODAY IS ELECTION DAY.
USE OUR TOOL: MAKE YOUR VOTE PLAN FOR TODAY. [1]
Throughout this election, you committed to building a Canada that works, together.
Today is the day you can make good on that commitment - by casting your vote for your local Green candidate.
We can win. We have the support to elect Green MPs all across Canada. All we need now is your vote.
VOTE RIGHT NOW, BEFORE IT’S TOO LATE.
Thanks,
Paul
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER Green Party of Canada
P.S. Before you vote, make sure you have the proper identification. You can find out exactly what identification you need to vote here: ELECTIONS.CA [2]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: vote vote vote
message.text:
Michael --
The election booths are closing soon. Time is running out.
Find out when, where, and how to vote here: ELECTIONS.CA [1]
Do not miss your last opportunity to vote in today's election.
WE CAN WIN. WE HAVE THE MOMENTUM WE NEED TO ELECT GREENS ALL ACROSS CANADA. BUT IT’S STILL A TIGHT RACE.
Your vote can make the difference.
VOTE RIGHT NOW, BEFORE IT’S TOO LATE. [1]
Thanks,
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR Green Party of Canada
P.S. Before you vote, make sure you have the proper identification. You can find out exactly what identification you need to vote here: ELECTIONS.CA [1]

from.name: Claire Martin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: act now
message.text:
Michael --
We are facing a climate crisis, and for the last decade, politicians in Ottawa have failed Canadians.
WE ARE LESS THAN TWO WEEKS AWAY FROM THE PARIS CLIMATE CONFERENCE -- THIS IS THE TIME TO ACT.
We finally have a government that is open to the idea of tackling climate change, but they won't take the necessary steps unless we are there to push them.
We are the only party that has consistently made climate action a priority, and the only party that will push Prime Minister Trudeau to go fast enough and far enough on the environment.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO SAY YOU SUPPORT CLIMATE ACTION. [1]
Canada's new government campaigned on the idea of "real change," so let's hold them to that promise -- especially on the environment.
Now is not the time to stop fighting for what we believe in. It is the time to double our efforts.
SAY YOU ARE WITH US -- ADD YOUR NAME TODAY. [1]
Here is the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/CLIMATE-ACTION [1]
Thanks,
Claire
CLAIRE MARTIN CLIMATE CHANGE CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Michael, have your say
message.text:
At our core, we are a grassroots party. That is why your feedback is so important.
We would like your opinion on this year's federal election campaign - what you think worked, and what you think didn't.
Your feedback is critical as we move forward. Please take a moment to fill out our survey, it will only take about two minutes.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/SURVEY [1]
Thanks,
CRAIG
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: it’s not too late
message.text:
Severe storms, rising grocery bills, flooded basements, unaffordable disaster insurance, and water shortages.
These are the realities of climate change. They don't have to be the realities of our future.
IT’S NOT TOO LATE -- BUT WE HAVE TO TAKE CLIMATE ACTION NOW. [1]
Tomorrow, Elizabeth May will join world leaders for the start of the Paris Climate Conference.
This is our last and best chance to sign an international agreement that will allow us to avoid the worst consequences of climate change.
WE ARE RUNNING OUT OF TIME -- ACT NOW. [1]
We are the only party that has consistently made climate action a priority, and the only party that will push Prime Minister Trudeau to go fast enough and far enough on the environment.
Say you are with us, add your name today.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/CLIMATE-ACTION [1]
Thanks for your support,
EMILY
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: my thoughts on 2015...
message.text:
Dear Michael,
As we approach the end of the year, I want to share with you my thoughts on the election that has just passed.
It is unfortunate we did not win more seats despite our excellent candidates and strong campaign. This became an election about getting rid of Stephen Harper rather than about the issues or who was the best representative. But our message was not lost - knocking on doors from Fredericton to Guelph to Vancouver Island, I heard again and again that Canadians believe in and respect our party. So many who felt that they couldn't vote for us at this time said to me, "next time, I will vote Green."
That being said, I am optimistic about our future.
READ MORE >> [1]
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA

message.subject: today I learned
message.text:
Did you know that your contribution to the Green Party of Canada is eligible for a generous tax credit?
Help us fight against climate change and risky trade deals, and for good local jobs and representative democracy.
AT TAX TIME, YOU CAN GET UP TO 75% BACK ON THE DONATION YOU MAKE TODAY.
Here's what that means:
YOUR DONATION Your Tax Credit WHAT YOU PAY
$20 $15 $5
$40 $30 $10
$100 $75 $25
$400 $300 $100
$1500 $650 $850
Donate today: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks for your continued support,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada

message.subject: because of you, Michael
message.text:
Michael,
LAST YEAR, YOU MADE A BIG DIFFERENCE.
You helped us prepare for the most important election in a decade -- your donation allowed us to recruit incredible candidates and reach out to Green supporters across the country.
Thanks to you, we can be proud of our performance in 2015. We gained almost 10,000 new members. We fought for the CBC and against Bill C-51, Harper's secret police bill. We re-elected our leader, Elizabeth May -- and she worked tirelessly in Paris earlier this month to help negotiate a new international climate treaty.
TODAY, I’M ASKING YOU TO SUPPORT US WITH A DONATION ONCE AGAIN.
[1]
In 2016, we'll be working hard to advocate for a fair voting system and a comprehensive plan to tackle climate change. We will be representing your interests, but we need your help to hold the new government to account.
STAND WITH US TODAY -- MAKE YOUR DONATION OF $.
Here is the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks, your continued support means so much,
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. All donations made before December 31, 2015 are eligible for a generous TAX CREDIT OF UP TO 75%.
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Michael, does this look right?
message.text:
Michael,
We're closing up the books for 2015, and we want to make sure our records are up to date.
Here's the 2015 Supporter Record we have for this exact email address:
--2015 donation total: $ --Donation needed today: $ --Cost after tax credit: $
SUGGESTED ACTION: DONATE TODAY TO MAKE THE MOST OF YOUR 2015 TAX CREDIT. [1]
Right now, we are busy finalizing our Party's 2016 budget -- what we raise in the next five days is essential to determining what we can achieve next year.
Help us end the year strong, and set us up for a successful 2016.
[1]
Thanks for your support,
Lorna
LORNA MUNGUR FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. IF WE'VE MADE A MISTAKE ABOVE, WE APOLOGIZE -- IT MAY BE THAT YOU DONATED WITH A DIFFERENT EMAIL ADDRESS OR WE MISSED YOUR RECENT CONTRIBUTION, AND WITH A QUICK REPLY TO THIS EMAIL WE CAN FIX YOUR FILE.
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9 AM - 9PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Pipelines. Votes. Milk.
message.text:
Michael, why is 2016 an important year for the Green Party of Canada?
_“IF THE REGULATORY APPLICATION PROCESS IS SUCCESSFUL, CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW [TRANSMOUNTAIN] PIPELINE COULD BEGIN IN 2016.”_ – KINDER MORGAN PRESS RELEASE
_“PRIME MINISTER-DESIGNATE JUSTIN TRUDEAU MAY HAVE CAMPAIGNED ON ELECTORAL CHANGE, BUT POLITICAL SCIENTISTS SAY HE MAY WANT TO RETHINK THAT PROMISE NOW HE HAS A MAJORITY GOVERNMENT.”_ – CBC POLITICS
_“TPP [TRANS-PACIFIC PARTNERSHIP] WOULD ALLOW MILK FROM COWS RECEIVING HORMONES INTO CANADA.”_ – CBC NEWS
If you care about defending our environment, creating good local jobs, and safeguarding our democracy for generations to come, you know it is critical that Green ideas are at the forefront of the debate in 2016.
HELP ENSURE THE GREEN PARTY IS STRONGER THAN EVER IN 2016 -- DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Julian

message.subject: still committed
message.text:
, IT IS MY JOB TO MAKE SURE WE HIT OUR YEAR-END FUNDRAISING TARGET.
We only have 48 hours left to meet our goal of $500,000.
I feel humbled by how many people have already stepped up to the plate. After a long election year, thousands of Canadians like you are showing us that they are still committed to the Green Party. But we're still $118,000 short of hitting our target.
DONATE $ TO ENSURE WE HIT OUR TARGET BY MIDNIGHT THURSDAY. [1]
Your donation will ensure that we can keep fighting on behalf of all Canadians in 2016.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Cheers,
CORA
Cora LaRussa Director of Fundraising Green Party of Canada
P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 9 am ET - 9 pm ET, every day until January 1st. If you don't get through right away, please call again.
[2] [3]

message.subject: just 1 day...
message.text:
Michael,
Just one day until we have to submit our quarterly fundraising results with Elections Canada.
This time of year is critical for our party. The money raised in the next 24 hours will determine whether we can afford to continue doing the work that so many Canadians now expect from us.
THAT IS WHY I AM ASKING FOR YOUR SUPPORT -- DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
Remember, every donation made before December 31st is eligible for a generous tax credit of up to 75%.
YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS CRITICAL -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9 AM - 9 PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: opportunity
message.text:
Michael --
Hitting our December fundraising target is crucial, because 2016 is such an important year.
Over the next year, our government will decide whether or not to ratify the dangerous Trans-Pacific Partnership, make critical decisions about the future of our voting system, and determine whether they will approve several risky pipeline projects.
If you care about building a more prosperous and sustainable future, you know it is critical that Green ideas are at the forefront of those discussions.
ENSURE THE GREEN PARTY IS STRONGER THAN EVER IN 2016 -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
Elizabeth will continue to work with -and push- the Liberal government in Ottawa. But, she can't do that without your help.
DONATE $ TODAY, SO WE CAN CONTINUE FIGHTING FOR YOU. [1]
[1]
Cheers,
KYLE
Kyle Tate Digital Director Green Party of Canada

message.subject: hurry! it’s not too late!
message.text:
Michael,
Our fundraising director just sent me a quick update -- we are still a few dollars short of hitting our year end fundraising target.
If everyone reading this email chips in right now, we will hit our December fundraising target within the hour.
I need you to step up. Donate $20.00 before the midnight deadline.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Happy New Year,
ELIZABETH
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
P.S. Remember, every donation made before midnight is eligible for a generous tax credit of up to 75%.
P.P.S. If you would like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447, from 9am - 9pm ET. If you have trouble getting through, please try again!
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])
Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: Live - Elizabeth’s Kinder Morgan testimony
message.text:
Dear Michael,
Elizabeth May will testify tomorrow, Thursday, January 21, at the hearings on the proposed Kinder Morgan pipeline in Burnaby, BC. The National Energy Board (NEB) - the body that must approve or reject the proposal - is hearing testimony from stakeholders who will be affected by the project.
YOU CAN WATCH HER TESTIMONY LIVE, HERE: http://www.greenparty.ca/sites/all/modules/civicrm/extern/url.php?u=126787&qid=452472 42 [1]
The controversial Kinder Morgan pipeline extension has been opposed by First Nations communities, local advocates, and environmental organizations.
Elizabeth is expected to speak at 9:30am PT, following the Squamish First Nation. WATCH IT LIVE. [1]
Here is everything you need to know:
DATE: Thursday, January 21, 2016 TIME: 9:30 am - 10:30 am PT (12:30 pm - 1:30 pm ET) LIVE-STREAM: http://www.greenparty.ca/sites/all/modules/civicrm/extern/url.php?u=1267 87&qid=45247242 [1] LOCATION: Delta Burnaby Hotel and Conference Centre, 4331 Dominion Street, Burnaby BC (MAP [2])
GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: we wouldn’t do this, he might
message.text:
Michael --
The Trans-Pacific Partnership, known as the TPP, is the wrong deal for Canada.
PLAIN AND SIMPLE, IT PUTS OUR JOBS, COMMUNITIES, AND ENVIRONMENT AT RISK.
Stephen Harper's Conservatives negotiated this deal, and Prime Minister Trudeau's team is signalling that they want to sign it.
The TPP will weaken our food safety regulations, permitting previously banned growth hormones to find their way into milk sold in Canada.
The TPP will damage our copyright laws, allowing multinational corporations to profit at the expense of Canadian entrepreneurs and small businesses.
The TPP will make our medicine more expensive, protecting the profits of American pharmaceutical companies instead of Canadians in need of medical care.
And, the TPP will erode Canada's sovereignty, allowing foreign corporations to sue for damages in secretive tribunals when our laws get in the way of their profits.
THERE IS STILL TIME TO STOP THIS DEAL, BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP. SIGN-ON TODAY TO TELL PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU NOT TO RATIFY THE TPP. [1]
This is about protecting local jobs, Canadian consumers, and our treasured environment.
MAKE SURE PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU HEARS YOUR VOICE -- ADD YOUR NAME TODAY. [1]
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/STOP-THE-TPP [1]
Thanks,
Paul
PAUL MANLY Trade Critic Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: he’s doing it today
message.text:
Michael,
JUSTIN TRUDEAU AND THE LIBERALS ARE SIGNING THE TPP TODAY.
We have to STOP THEM FROM RATIFYING IT. [1]
Today's signing is a big step towards the ratification of a risky trade deal that hurts Canadian workers and Canadian sovereignty.
The TPP will put corporate profits above consumer security and cost over 55,000 Canadians their jobs.
TELL JUSTIN TRUDEAU AND THE LIBERALS THAT THE TPP IS THE WRONG DEAL FOR CANADA.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY. [1]
CRAIG
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: join Elizabeth in Halifax
message.text:
Dear Michael,
On Monday, February 22nd, Elizabeth May will be in Halifax giving a FREE PUBLIC LECTURE on DEMOCRATIC REFORM IN CANADA.
Don't miss this fun and informative evening with Elizabeth. Mark your calendar today!
Here is everything you need to know:
ELIZABETH MAY ON DEMOCRATIC REFORM Where: DALHOUSIE UNIVERSITY, Room 105, Weldon Law Building - 6061 University Avenue (MAP [1]) When: 5:30PM - Monday, February 22, 2016
We can't wait to see you there,
GREEN PARTY OF CANADA

message.subject: guilty, angry, and fed up…
message.text:
Michael,
How did I feel after I cast my ballot in the 2015 Election?
GUILTY, ANGRY, AND FED UP WITH A VOTING SYSTEM THAT JUST DOESN’T WORK!
I have been a Green supporter for over ten years, but this time I was tricked into voting strategically, because I was convinced (wrongly) that it was "the only way to get rid of Stephen Harper."
I know now that those fears were exaggerated. Harper lost by a wide margin; his fate was sealed regardless of my "strategic" vote.
THE REALITY IS THAT WE NEED TO FIX OUR BROKEN VOTING SYSTEM.
Our new government promised that 2015 would be the last first-past-the-post election in Canadian history. That is why the Green Party of Canada is partnering with multiple organizations in a non-partisan effort to ensure the Trudeau administration introduces a system of PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION.
Yesterday, we launched our campaign, and over the next twelve months we will be mobilizing volunteers and supporters to ensure that Trudeau keeps his promise to fix our voting system.
DONATE $ SO WE CAN GET TO WORK RIGHT AWAY ON THIS PROJECT. [1]
The future is in our hands -- a fair and equal voting system is within reach.
The work starts today. DONATE $ NOW. [1]
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
SAMANTHA
Green Party Supporter Calgary, Alberta
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: did you vote?
message.text:
Michael,
In 2015, the Liberal government won 39% of the popular vote and 100% of the power in Parliament.
That statistic drives me nuts! It reminds me that the broken electoral system that gave Stephen Harper a majority government still exists!
IT IS TIME TO FIX CANADA’S VOTING SYSTEM ONCE AND FOR ALL – ADD YOUR NAME TODAY. [1]
Justin Trudeau promised to make 2015 the last first-past-the-post election in Canadian history.
THIS IS OUR ONE CHANCE TO ENSURE THAT NEXT TIME YOU HEAD TO THE VOTING BOOTH, YOUR VOICE IS HEARD AND YOUR VOTE IS COUNTED.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO SUPPORT PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION. [1]
Proportional representation is the only system that ensures every vote is counted equally, no matter where you live or who you vote for.
NEXT ELECTION, LET’S MAKE SURE EVERY VOTE IS COUNTED EQUALLY.
ADD YOUR NAME NOW. [1]
Thanks,
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Marlene Wells, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Ring in Spring with us - GPNS gathering
message.text:
Dear Michael,
The snow is starting to melt all around us, and we're feeling the pent-up winter energy rising to the surface, along with the crocus', tulips and daffodils we're sure to see soon!
The Green Party of Canada wants to share this event from the Green Party of Nova Scotia (GPNS) - This might be just the way to ring in Spring!
HERE ARE ALL THE EVENT DETAILS:
WHEN: March 20 at 4:00 pm (the first day of Spring!) WHERE: The Nook, 2118 Gottingen St., Halifax - MAP [1]
This will be a chance to share with us your favourite GPNS policies, petitions to sign that relate to those policies, express what you'd like to see amended, and fun ways to 'vote' for the policies you'd like to see more action on. You can review the current GPNS policy document HERE [2].
This is also a great opportunity to get an update on the work we've been doing towards the Leadership Convention, to meet some of the current executive, and to ask any questions you might have about running for any of the GPNS EXECUTIVE POSITIONS [3].
We're looking forward to the conversations that will take place. All are welcome - invite your friends and family!
We hope to see you there!
Marlene Wells Organizer, Eastern Canada Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: the absolute minimum
message.text:
Michael,
We are just a few days away from the first major fundraising deadline of 2016.
As the Director of Fundraising, there are two numbers that I have to keep a close eye on leading up to March 31st: our quarterly budget and our stretch goal.
The quarterly budget is the number we have to hit just to keep the lights on at Green Party headquarters -- and the good news is we're on pace to fly past that number by midnight tonight.
THAT’S WHY I NOW HAVE MY EYES ON OUR STRETCH GOAL -- DONATE $ TODAY TO HELP US GET THERE. [1]
If we hit our stretch goal, we can afford to invest in projects that we wouldn't otherwise be able to fund. From a nationwide tour for Elizabeth May to discuss electoral reform and the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP), to increased resources for our organizers, volunteers and supporters to build up their local community teams.
WILL YOU HELP US HIT OUR STRETCH GOAL BY DONATING $ RIGHT NOW? [1]
To hit that target, we need to raise $120,000 in seven days -- I know we can do it if everyone steps up.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Cora
CORA LARUSSA DIRECTOR OF FUNDRAISING GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: our work never stops
message.text:
Michael,
The Trans-Pacific Partnership. The Kinder Morgan and Energy East pipelines. The construction of a nuclear waste disposal site on the shores of Lake Huron.
The lobby groups who are pushing for these dangerous deals and risky projects never stop working.
THAT’S WHY WE CAN’T AFFORD TO SLOW DOWN -- NOT EVEN FOR ONE SECOND.
The first major fundraising deadline of 2016 is Thursday at midnight.
CAN YOU DONATE $ BEFORE THURSDAY'S DEADLINE? [1]
We'll never stop fighting to defend the communities we call home, and the environment that sustains us -- but we can't do our work without your support.
[1]
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: at midnight
message.text:
Michael,
The generosity of Green Party supporters never ceases to amaze me!
With less than 24 hours until our first fundraising deadline of 2016, I wanted to send you a quick note to let you know we have already raised $105,000 this week.
That means we are just $15,000 short of hitting our first quarter fundraising goal.
Every day, I'm fighting for a greener, fairer and more prosperous future for all Canadians -- but I can't do it without your support.
Help us hit our first quarter fundraising deadline by donating $10.00 today.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
I cannot thank you enough for your continuing support,
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

message.subject: why we fight
message.text:
Dear Michael,
Tomorrow is Earth Day, and if you've been reading the headlines this week, you got another crude reminder of why we have to keep fighting.
TransCanada's Keystone pipeline sprang _another_ leak, fracking in Alberta and British Columbia was confirmed to be causing earthquakes, and a report was released showing that the Energy East pipeline will put the drinking water of over _5 million_ Canadians at risk.
THIS EARTH DAY, MAKE A DIFFERENCE BY ADDING YOUR NAME TO DEMAND CLIMATE ACTION. [1]
Tomorrow, Elizabeth May will be at the United Nations as national leaders from around the world sign the Paris Agreement. In order to have any chance of avoiding a 1.5°C global average temperature increase, as pledged by 195 nations in Paris, far more aggressive reductions in carbon pollution are needed.
WE HAVE TO KEEP THE PRESSURE ON PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU AND HIS TEAM -- ADD YOUR NAME TO ENSURE HE FOLLOWS-UP PROMISING TALK WITH CONCRETE ACTION. [1]
Canada was key in setting a positive agenda at COP 21, but our new government has still failed to replace the weak climate targets put in place by the Harper Conservatives. If we want to live up to the commitments we made in Paris, that's just not good enough.
Let Elizabeth know you've got her back as she continues to fight for a better, greener future -- add your name to demand Prime Minister Trudeau act quickly and aggressively to tackle climate change.
Here's the link: GREEN.CA/EARTH-DAY [1]
Thanks for your continued support,
JEFF
Jeff Braunstein Digital Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Elizabeth is coming to Halifax
message.text:
Michael,
Next weekend, ELIZABETH MAY IS COMING TO HALIFAX, AND YOU’RE INVITED!
Elizabeth will be joining the Nova Scotia Greens Interim Leader Brynn Nheiley, and Green MLA and PEI GP Leader Peter Bevan-Baker, as they launch the NS Greens Leadership Convention.
This is a great opportunity to meet other Greens in the area, engage in policy discussion, and help grow support in your community for the issues most important to you.
HERE ARE THE DETAILS FOR THIS CAN’T-MISS EVENT: WHEN: Saturday April 30, 2016, 2:30pm WHERE: The Bus Stop Theatre, 2203 Gottingen Street, Halifax (MAP [1])
For more information, visit the FACEBOOK EVENT PAGE. [2]
We'll see you there!
GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: non-voting member??
message.text:
Dear Michael,
The Liberal Party has made a point-blank promise to Canadians:
_"We will make every vote count...We will convene an all-party Parliamentary committee to review a wide variety of reforms, such as ranked ballots, proportional representation, mandatory voting, and online voting."_
This morning, the Minister of Democratic Institutions finally announced the creation of that committee. The good news is that Elizabeth May will be on the committee; the disappointing news is that she will be a "non-voting" member.
WITH ELIZABETH NOT HAVING A FULL VOTE, WE WILL HAVE TO WORK EVEN HARDER TO MAKE OUR VOICES HEARD.
Have your say in the future of our democracy. SEND A MESSAGE TO ELIZABETH AND LET HER KNOW WHAT IDEAS YOU WANT BROUGHT TO THE TABLE. [1]
In my opinion, Elizabeth deserved a vote on this committee. More importantly, the 600,000 Canadians who cast a ballot for the Green Party deserved a vote on this committee.
This committee belongs to Canadians, it is your chance to make your voice heard. Don't waste it.
Here's the link: GREEN.CA/FAIR-DEMOCRACY [1]
Keep up the pressure,
EMILY
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: today’s big news
message.text:
Michael,
Just hours ago, the Harper-appointed National Energy Board (NEB) gave their conditional approval to the Kinder Morgan pipeline expansion.
ADD YOUR NAME NOW TO STOP THE KINDER MORGAN EXPANSION. [1]
I am not surprised the NEB made this decision, because they never have and never will be experts in environmental assessment. This should not have been their responsibility, but thanks to Harper's omnibus budget bill C38, they were given the power to lead this review.
In no way is this pipeline project in the best interest of Canadians. It will only create about 50 permanent full-time jobs, it will threaten some of our most fragile ecosystems including the Burrard Inlet and Jasper National Park, and over sixteen local First Nations have voiced their strong opposition to the expansion.
Even UNIFOR, one of Canada's biggest labour unions, has come out in opposition to the expansion, because they know that exporting raw bitumen means exporting Canadian jobs.
Plain and simple, this project is not worth the risk. LET PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU KNOW KINDER MORGAN’S EXPANSION CAN NOT BE APPROVED. [1]
Now that the NEB has had their say, it is up to the federal cabinet to determine Kinder Morgan's future.
Before Prime Minister Trudeau and his cabinet make their decision, make sure they hear your voice.
Here's the link: http://www.greenparty.ca/sites/all/modules/civicrm/extern/url.php?u= 149087&qid=47793109 [1]
Keep up the hard work,
Paul
PAUL GREGORY DIRECTOR OF OUTREACH GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: a birthday gift
message.text:
Michael,
Elizabeth's birthday is on Thursday, and everyone here in the Green Party office wanted to surprise her with a special birthday card.
Elizabeth loves nothing more than hearing from supporters like you, so I wanted to make sure you got the chance to sign your name and leave her a brief message of support:
GREENPARTY.CA/BIRTHDAY-CARD [1]
Thanks! I know she's going to love this!
JEFF
Jeff Braunstein Digital Director Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Elizabeth May's record
message.text:
Michael,
Safeguarding Canadian jobs from the destructive Trans-Pacific Partnership.
Defending our coast from tankers carrying toxic, climate-killing bitumen.
Protecting the air we breathe and water we drink for generations to come.
IN THESE FIGHTS – AND SO MANY MORE – ELIZABETH MAY IS IN YOUR CORNER.
LET HER KNOW YOU’VE GOT HER BACK BY DONATING $ TODAY. [1]
We need to raise $40,000 before the second quarter fundraising deadline hits at midnight on June 30th.
CHIP-IN BEFORE TIME RUNS OUT.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Cheers,
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9 AM - 5 PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: there's only one
message.text:
Michael,
There's only one MP who stood strong against Stephen Harper's secret police Bill C-51 from day one.
There's only one MP who has consistently called for a halt to dangerous pipeline projects like Energy East and Kinder Morgan.
There's only one MP who has never wavered in her opposition to the job-killing Trans-Pacific Partnership.
ELIZABETH MAY IS BACK IN OTTAWA FIGHTING FOR _YOU_.
CAN YOU DONATE $ BEFORE TOMORROW’S CRITICAL DEADLINE TO MAKE SURE SHE HAS THE RESOURCES SHE NEEDS? [1]
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Cheers,
CORA
Cora LaRussa Director of Fundraising Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9AM - 5PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: Michael, this is the perfect opportunity
message.text:
Michael,
Tonight at midnight is a critical fundraising deadline for our party -- this is your last opportunity before the quarter ends to pitch-in and make sure we have the resources we need to keep fighting for you.
I got into politics because I wanted to speak out on behalf of those who are all too often ignored.
Put simply, I work every day to ensure citizens are heard.
Our party is hard at work supporting my efforts in Parliament and across the country -- whether it is stopping the reckless Trans-Pacific Partnership, defending our coasts from risky pipeline projects, or working to guarantee that every vote counts in the next election.
IF YOU’VE BEEN WAITING FOR THE PERFECT TIME TO MAKE YOUR FIRST DONATION OF 2016, THIS IS IT. [1]
Thanks so much for your generous support, I couldn't do this work without you.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks again,
ELIZABETH
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447

Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: just what you need...
message.text:
,
If you're anything like me, you consume a lot of news. I know it's been a tough month for a whole bunch of reasons, so I thought I'd take this opportunity to share with you my favorite headlines from the last few weeks:
_“CALIFORNIA POWERS 6 MILLION HOMES WITH SOLAR ENERGY, SLAYS RECORD”_
_“WORLD'S BIGGEST SOLAR AND STORAGE PROJECTS PLANNED FOR AUSTRALIA”_
_“SOON SOLAR WILL BE THE CHEAPEST POWER EVERYWHERE”_
Other countries are stepping up to take the lead on climate change. Sweden just promised to be 100% renewable by 2040, and developing countries like India are moving forward with plans to build some of the largest clean energy projects in the world!
ADD YOUR NAME TO DEMAND THAT CANADA INVEST IN THE FUTURE, NOT THE PAST. [1]
The renowned climate activist Bill McKibben once said, "Climate change is the single biggest thing that humans have ever done on this planet. The one thing that needs to be bigger is our movement to stop it."
CANADA NEEDS TO LEAD THAT CHARGE.
TELL PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU THAT CANADA HAS TO BRING IN A TOUGHER CLIMATE TARGET AND INCREASE INVESTMENTS IN CLEAN ENERGY. [1]
It's time to replace our weak, Harper-era climate target with one that will help us meet our Paris Agreement commitments.
ADD YOUR NAME HERE: GREENPARTY.CA/ACT-ON-CLIMATE [1]
Cheers,
Jeff
JEFF BRAUNSTEIN DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Bill McKibben will be giving a special address at our 2016 Convention. Make sure you catch all the festivities by JOINING US IN OTTAWA FROM AUGUST 5TH TO 7TH. [2]
[3] [4]

message.subject: good news or bad news?
message.text:
Michael,
In just a few hours, Elizabeth May will take the stage in downtown Ottawa to launch Convention 2016. As soon as she wraps up her welcome address, I want to give her some good news.
Our Executive Director has set a target of raising $25,000 before convention comes to a close on Sunday. I can't wait to give Elizabeth an update at the end of tonight's events, letting her know how many Canadians have already stepped up to support the Green Party.
MAKE SURE THE UPDATE IS ALL GOOD NEWS BY DONATING $ RIGHT NOW. [1]
This year's Convention comes at an incredibly important moment for our party and our movement. It is our chance to re-energize our grassroots, and ensure that we distinguish ourselves as the best choice for progressive voters in 2019.
Michael, we can't build a strong, durable and successful Green Party without your generous support. WOULD YOU PLEASE CONSIDER DONATING $ TODAY TO ENSURE WE CAN HIT THE GROUND RUNNING AS SOON AS CONVENTION 2016 ENDS? [1]
AFTER YOU’VE MADE YOUR CONVENTION 2016 DONATION [1], MAKE SURE YOU TUNE IN TO TONIGHT’S SPEECHES. We'll be streaming all the must see moments live, starting with ELIZABETH’S WELCOME ADDRESS AT 7:00PM ET. [2]
Cheers,
CORA
Cora LaRussa Director of Fundraising Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Elizabeth going live
message.text:
Michael,
ELIZABETH MAY WILL BE MAKING HER KEYNOTE ADDRESS TO THE 2016 CONVENTION TONIGHT AT 7:40 ET. DON’T MISS IT!
Here's the link: FACEBOOK.COM/GREENPARTYOFCANADA [1]
In solidarity, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: you're amazing!
message.text:
Michael,
I just wrapped up my keynote speech at our convention here in Ottawa, and I have to say, the atmosphere in the room was incredible.
WHENEVER I GET TO SPEND TIME WITH GREEN PARTY SUPPORTERS I AM BLOWN AWAY BY THEIR ENTHUSIASM, OPTIMISM AND ENGAGEMENT. YOU ARE ALL TRULY AMAZING!
On a personal level, this convention has reenergized me. It has reminded me why I fight so hard each and every day.
Michael, we are the verge of making a real breakthrough. From achieving meaningful climate action to replacing our perverse voting system with a fair voting system, positive change is within reach. But, in order to make that change a reality, we need to continue encouraging and inspiring an ever growing movement of Canadians who believe the Green Party does speak truth to power.
Let's capitalize on the momentum we started building this weekend, and turn it into a green movement that sweeps the country from St. John's to Victoria. DONATE $ TODAY [1].
HERE’S THE LINK: SECURE.GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks for your continued support,
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------

message.subject: just imagine
message.text:
Michael,
DOES YOUR VOTE MATTER?
_"Our polls consistently show that Canadians like the Green Party and its leader, but don't seem willing to vote for them, either out of fear of splitting the progressive vote or concern that their vote won't make a difference."_
Frank Graves President, EKOS Polling
This quote from one of Canada's leading political pollsters tells us that many Canadians think their vote doesn't count.
According to EKOS research, the majority of Canadians support a shift to a proportional voting system. One where the number of seats each party has in Parliament is representative of the number of votes they received -- so no one has to feel that their vote was "wasted".
Imagine a government where politicians work together for the good of the country and their constituents. Imagine having not just one, but many voices standing up in Parliament for a serious climate action plan.
THIS IS ABOUT BUILDING A DEMOCRACY THAT WORKS FOR _ALL_ CANADIANS, NOT JUST THE ONES WHO VOTE FOR ESTABLISHMENT PARTIES.
Elizabeth May is working hard for electoral reform to ensure that every vote matters. ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO SHOW YOU’RE READY FOR PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION. [1] [1]
HERE’S THE LINK: GREENPARTY.CA/MAKE-EVERY-VOTE-COUNT [1]
Thanks for all you do,
PAUL
Paul Gregory Director of Outreach Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: did you hear?
message.text:
Michael,
They said they would be different. They said they would lead on climate change.
BUT IT’S BECOMING CLEAR THAT JUSTIN TRUDEAU AND THE LIBERALS AREN’T PREPARED TO STAND UP FOR CANADIANS.
Last week, Environment Minister Catherine McKenna said the Liberals are satisfied with the carbon emissions targets set by Stephen Harper's Conservative government. What?!
LET’S MOVE CANADA FORWARD, TOGETHER. WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO AMPLIFY THE GREEN VOICE ON CLIMATE CHANGE AND DEMAND STRONGER ACTION TODAY. [1]
THESE TARGETS ARE WEAK AND FRANKLY, NOT GOOD ENOUGH. Canadians have already lost a decade because of the Conservatives' inaction on climate change. Reducing greenhouse gases by 30% below 2005 levels by 2030 is too little, too late, and incompatible with the commitments we made in Paris at COP21.
Don't let the Liberals drag their feet on climate action. WE NEED TO GET SERIOUS NOW, or else we will face the consequences: rising sea levels, erratic weather and a devastated economy.
WE’RE REACHING A CRUCIAL FUNDRAISING DEADLINE ON SEPTEMBER 30. WILL YOU DONATE $1 RIGHT NOW TO HELP US CLEAN UP THE FUTURE? [1]
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/SEPT-2016-DEADLINE [1]
Thanks,
CRAIG
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: unfair, undemocratic
message.text:
Michael,
It was back to work for the MPs in Ottawa last week, but I know one MP who was working for you all summer long -- Elizabeth May.
Elizabeth met with thousands of Canadians to discuss our urgent need for bold climate action and a replacement for our unfair, undemocratic voting system.
THERE ARE SO MANY PRESSING ISSUES IN FRONT OF US RIGHT NOW, AND IT’S MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER THAT WE HOLD THE GOVERNMENT TO ACCOUNT.
SEPTEMBER 30 IS A CRITICAL FUNDRAISING DEADLINE FOR OUR PARTY. CHIP IN $ TODAY TO MAKE SURE WE CAN CONTINUE DEFENDING YOUR INTERESTS. [1]
We don't have the same resources as other parties -- but we've got grassroots supporters like you, and that encourages our team to keep fighting.
A few of the things we're working on right now: * A real plan to confront the climate crisis * An outright rejection of Bill-C51 -- the Harper Secret Police bill, that has yet to be repealed * A proportional voting system to make sure every Canadian's voice counts on election day
DONATE TODAY AND HELP US MEET OUR FUNDRAISING DEADLINE:
GREENPARTY.CA/SEPT-2016-DEADLINE [1]
Thank you,
CORA
Cora LaRussa Director of Fundraising Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: they did it again
message.text:
FUNDRAISING DEADLINE: 11:59 PM, FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 30, 2016
Michael, here's why you should donate now:
In late July, our government issued permits for the Site C Dam project on the Peace River in BC, betraying promises made to First Nations and putting business interests before environmental and human rights.
Last week, the Liberals announced that they are keeping the _same weak climate targets_ that the Harper Conservatives introduced, abandoning any real commitment to protecting our children from the catastrophic impacts of the climate crisis.
And just last night, the Liberals approved the construction of the Petronas Pacific Northwest liquified natural gas (LNG) terminal in BC, which will devastate the wild salmon habitat and spew out carbon emissions equivalent to putting a million new cars on Canadian roads!
DURING THE ELECTION, THE LIBERALS COMMITTED TO “REAL CHANGE” IN CANADA’S CLIMATE POLICY. IT'S BEEN NEARLY A YEAR, AND ALL WE'RE GETTING ARE BROKEN PROMISES AND FLASHBACKS TO THE HARPER DECADE.
STAND WITH US AND DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
I'm outraged the Trudeau Cabinet would go back on its word.
HELP US SEND A MESSAGE -- WE’RE WATCHING, AND WE WON’T LET THEM GET AWAY WITH RECKLESS DECISIONS.
Chip in right now: GREENPARTY.CA/SEPT-2016-DEADLINE [1]
Thanks for all you do,
LYNNE
Lynne Quarmby Science Critic Green Party of Canada Shadow Cabinet
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Will you help, Michael?
message.text:
Dear Michael,
Every time we set a fundraising deadline, I'm overwhelmed by the support of Canadians.You have reached out from BC's pristine coastlines, to the wilds of Newfoundland, and shown us how much you care.
When we need you, you take action, and I'm so grateful for that.
Can you help us edge towards our September fundraising target? We're still $30,000 away -- every donation that comes in before tomorrow at midnight will make a huge difference.
WILL YOU CHIP IN $ OR WHATEVER YOU CAN AFFORD RIGHT NOW? [1]
Your contribution will help us stand up for a greener future and a stronger democracy.
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/SEPT-2016-DEADLINE [1]
With my sincere gratitude,
ELIZABETH
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------

from.name: Paul Gregory, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Deadline for Democracy
message.text:
Michael --
As you are probably aware, our government is considering changes to our voting system. Prime Minister Trudeau has promised to replace our unfair First-Past-the-Post system with one that will make every vote count.
The SPECIAL COMMITTEE ON ELECTORAL REFORM (ERRE) [1] is wrapping up their cross-Canada consultation and we wanted to remind you about an upcoming deadline.
YOU HAVE UNTIL MIDNIGHT (EDT) TOMORROW, OCTOBER 7, TO SUBMIT YOUR FEEDBACK TO THE COMMITTEE ONLINE. THE EASIEST WAY TO DO THAT IS TO ANSWER THE ONLINE ERRE QUESTIONNAIRE [2].
[2]
It is crucial that the committee hear from you! WE NEED AS MANY CANADIANS AS POSSIBLE TO ADD THEIR VOICE TO THE CALL FOR PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION -- the best way to improve our democracy.
REMEMBER TO SUBMIT YOUR FEEDBACK BEFORE MIDNIGHT EDT FRIDAY, OCTOBER 7. [2]
If you want to say more, email ERRE@PARL.GC.CA.
Thank you for doing your part to make every vote count!
PAUL
Paul Gregory Director of Outreach Green Party of Canada
P.S. Our democracy needs an upgrade -- check out our website for information that might help you fill out the survey: WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/EN/DEMOCRACY [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

message.subject: the grades are in…
message.text:
Michael,
It's been 365 days since the election that gave the Liberals yet another false majority.
Justin Trudeau says all the right things, from the importance of climate change to respecting First Nations treaty rights.
BUT ONE YEAR IN, LET’S LOOK AT THE FACTS. Where do he and the Liberals stand?
✖️ Continuing to SUBSIDIZE OIL COMPANIES with taxpayer money
✔️ Attending and showing leadership at the COP 21 summit in Paris
✔️ Ratifying the Paris Climate Agreement and setting a Canada-wide price on carbon
✖️ But … keeping the UNACCEPTABLE GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION TARGETS set by Stephen Harper's Conservatives, which they once described as "too weak"
✖️ Approving RISKY OIL AND GAS PROJECTS that will increase emissions and threaten local environments, like Woodfibre and Petronas Pacific Northwest LNG
❔ Support for BILL C-51, despite the bill's implication on Canadians' privacy rights
✖️ BETRAYING THEIR PROMISE to respect indigenous rights by approving the Site C dam in Northern BC
✖️ Pursuing HARPER-ERA TRADE DEALS like the Canada-European Trade Agreement (CETA)
How would you grade Trudeau and the Liberals?
[1]
WE HAVEN’T FORGOTTEN THE CAMPAIGN PROMISES, AND YOU SHOULDN’T EITHER. [1]IT’S TIME FOR YOU TO HAVE YOUR SAY -- TELL US HOW YOU THINK THE LIBERALS ARE DOING. [1]
HERE’S THE LINK: GREENPARTY.CA/EN/TRUDEAU-REPORT-CARD [1]
JEFF
Jeff Braunstein Digital Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: SOS: Kinder Morgan
message.text:
Michael, have you seen these headlines?
TORONTO STAR: _Liberals approve controversial natural gas project on B.C. coast_
THE GUARDIAN: _Environmentalists 'expected better' of Trudeau as Canada backs gas project_
BLOOMBERG: _Trudeau clears path for Canada to approve Kinder Morgan pipeline_
A decision on the expansion of the Kinder Morgan pipeline is reported to be imminent. Media sources and Liberal leaks seem coordinated to create the impression of inevitability. Given the Liberal government's recent approval of two major natural gas projects -- Woodfibre and Pacific NorthWest, as well as the destructive and unnecessary Site C Dam, I can guess which way they're leaning.
DO NOT WAIT UNTIL THIS DECISION IS MADE. THERE’S STILL TIME CHANGE THE TIDE ON THE KINDER MORGAN PIPELINE AND TANKER SCHEME.
SHOW THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT THAT YOU HAVEN’T FORGOTTEN ABOUT OUR LAND AND WATER -- SEND A MESSAGE TO PM JUSTIN TRUDEAU, NATURAL RESOURCES MINISTER JIM CARR, AND ENVIRONMENT MINISTER CATHERINE MCKENNA NOW. [1]
The approval of the Kinder Morgan pipeline will see hundreds of tankers filled with crude bitumen mixed with toxic diluent invading our coastal waters -- increasing tanker traffic on our coastline seven-fold. The pipeline and tanker expansion will threaten not only the southern resident killer whale population with extinction but also the sovereignty of First Nations, who have staunchly opposed these developments from the get-go.
MCKENNA AND THE LIBERALS WILL SAY KINDER MORGAN IS SAFE FOR OUR WATERWAYS AND CLIMATE, BUT THEY’RE USING STEPHEN HARPER’S TWISTED LOGIC. LET US MAKE IT CLEAR: IT’S NOT.
When the Liberals swept into government they promised real action on climate change. They promised that the broken process could not justify approving Kinder Morgan. Well… the process is still broken, but the Liberals seem to think a PR campaign can fix it. This is our last chance to hold them to their promise.
DEMAND PM TRUDEAU, ENVIRONMENT MINISTER CATHERINE MCKENNA, JIM CARR AND THE LIBERALS STOP THE PIPELINE AND TANKERS NOW. [1]
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/STOP-KINDER-MORGAN [1]
LYNNE
Lynne Quarmby Science Policy Critic Green Party of Canada Shadow Cabinet
[2] [3]

message.subject: Stop the pipeline
message.text:
Dear Michael,
Did you see Lynne Quarmby's email about the impending decision on the Kinder Morgan pipeline?
Last week, thousands of Green supporters like you pledged their opposition to the destructive pipeline expansion.
Will you join them?
SEND AN MESSAGE TO PRIME MINISTER JUSTIN TRUDEAU, NATURAL RESOURCES MINISTER JIM CARR, AND ENVIRONMENT MINISTER CATHERINE MCKENNA THAT YOU'RE AGAINST THIS PIPELINE. [1]
Kinder Morgan's three years of strategizing and lobbying are almost over. Soon, oil executives will be pouring champagne and celebrating the nearly three-fold expansion of their Trans Mountain pipeline.
Catherine McKenna is already hinting that the project will be approved. It won't be a surprise, given that the Liberals have already approved major liquefied natural gas projects - Woodfibre and Pacific NorthWest, as well as the destructive and unnecessary Site C Dam.
Kinder Morgan puts our water supply, fisheries, and wildlife habitats at risk. We can't afford to lose this battle.
SEND A MESSAGE RIGHT NOW. HERE’S THE LINK: GREENPARTY.CA/STOP-KINDER-MORGAN [1]
Thanks!
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Another broken Liberal promise?
message.text:
Dear Michael,
Have you seen this democracy survey promoted by millions of postcards sent out by the government?
WWW.MYDEMOCRACY.CA [1]
We know it's not what the Special Parliamentary Committee on Electoral Reform recommended, but go see it for yourself and please fill it out to show that we care about this issue.
Here's the problem: ALL THOSE QUESTIONS, AND THEY DIDN’T ASK WHAT VOTING SYSTEM YOU WANT. They used bizarre phrasing about values and trade-offs, but they didn't ask direct questions.
Moreover, on the key value of fairness -- ensuring that a party and leader with the minority of votes can never again have total power -- there is, at best, only one question that even hints at the issue. There are multiple questions about online and mandatory voting, but the only questions about proportional representation in Parliament are those unfairly skewed to the status quo (e.g. do you want more small parties even if the are "radical or extreme?").
That's what we want to fix, by giving you the opportunity to give the Liberals the feedback they were too afraid to ask for.
JUSTIN TRUDEAU PROMISED THAT IN ORDER TO MAKE SURE EVERY VOTE COUNT, 2015 WOULD BE THE LAST ELECTION HELD UNDER THE FIRST-PAST-THE-POST VOTING SYSTEM. BEFORE BREAKING THAT PROMISE, WE THINK HE SHOULD HEAR FROM YOU.
Here's our survey: GREEN.CA/THE-REAL-QUESTIONS [2]
Spoiler alert: It will take you about 2 minutes, because this isn't that complicated.
We'll be sending the results along with your comments to Prime Minister Trudeau and Minister of Democratic Institutions Maryam Monsef. We want them to hear from as many people as possible, so share the link after you fill it out.
Here it is once again: GREEN.CA/THE-REAL-QUESTIONS [2]
Thanks for making your voice heard,
PAUL
Paul Gregory Director of Outreach Green Party of Canada
[3] [4]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: The Kinder Morgan Disaster
message.text:
Dear Michael,
I was devastated to hear about the Liberal government's irresponsible decision to approve Kinder Morgan's pipeline expansion.
There is no evidence that there are adequate safeguards for preventing pipeline spills. And when a spill does occur, no one knows how to clean up the toxic mix of oil and chemicals that this pipeline will carry. Once it's spilled, diluted bitumen (dilbit) can't be removed from orca habitats. It can't be removed from our drinking water. And it can't be removed from our coast.
DEFEND OUR COAST. STOP KINDER MORGAN NOW. [1]
Prior to the 2015 election, the Liberal party promised to overhaul the National Energy Board's flawed approvals process. They broke that promise and now Canadians will live with the consequences for generations.
With the expansion of Kinder Morgan, Canada will never meet its commitment to the Paris Climate Agreement. This is a massive step back in our plan to hold global temperature increases to 1.5 degrees Celsius.
There is no evidence that expanding the Kinder Morgan pipeline will bring lasting jobs to British Columbia, as export pipelines such as this one also tend to export jobs after they're built.
On every front, the Kinder Morgan pipeline expansion is a disaster. But this fight isn't over. Stand with thousands of Canadians and voice your opposition to Kinder Morgan.
Until the pipeline expansion breaks ground, let's seize on every chance to turn back the government's devastating decision.
STOP KINDER MORGAN NOW. [1]
EMILY
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: My thoughts on 2016...
message.text:
Dear Michael,
I cannot thank you enough for your support through 2016. We have much to celebrate, even though it has been a very tough year. Following the 2015 election, I didn't think I would be going back to Parliament as the only Green MP. The workload has been grueling. I have to be honest. As wonderful as it was to see the end of the Stephen Harper era, it was a struggle to keep going.
I was certain the new government would be much better than the last, and it has been. Nevertheless, the decisions of the Trudeau administration-- approving the Woodfibre LNG plant in Howe Sound, maintaining the anti-environmental laws of omnibus bill C38, selling military vehicles to Saudi Arabia, issuing permits for the destruction of the Peace River Valley in northern BC, approving the monstrous LNG plant on Lelu Island BC, deciding to keep Harper's climate target, and most recently, approving the Kinder Morgan pipeline and tanker expansion--are body blows.
WE MUST CONTINUE TO PRESS THE NEW GOVERNMENT. THEY PROMISED BETTER AND THEY MUST BE HELD TO THAT PROMISE.
READ MORE >> [1]
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Michael, does this look right?
message.text:
Michael,
We're tallying our books for 2016, and we want to make sure our records are up-to-date.
Here's the 2016 Supporter Record for this email address:
--2016 donation total: $ --Donation needed today: $ --Cost after tax credit: $
SUGGESTED ACTION: DONATE TODAY TO MAKE THE MOST OF YOUR 2016 TAX CREDIT. [1]
Right now, we are finalizing our Party's 2017 budget, and here's the bottom line: what we raise in the next two weeks will determine what we can achieve next year.
There is so much important work on the horizon: defending our coastlines by halting the Kinder Morgan pipeline and tanker expansion, fixing our broken democracy through electoral reform, and greening our economy. You can help us end the year strong, and prepare us for a successful 2017.
[1]
Thanks for your support,
Meghan
MEGHAN DUBEAU FUNDRAISING AND MEMBERSHIP ADMINISTRATOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9 AM - 5 PM ET, MON-FRI IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
**Your record is associated with this exact email address. If you have donated using another email address, through your local riding association, or offline, it may not be reflected here. For questions and clarifications, call us at 1-866-868-3447.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: goodbye 2016
message.text:
Michael,
2017 will be an important year for the Green Party of Canada. In the next year, construction could begin on the Kinder Morgan pipeline and the Petronas Pacific NorthWest natural gas project. And the Energy East pipeline is next in line for approval.
THAT’S WHY WE’RE ASKING YOU TO DONATE NOW. [1] Remember that your contribution to the Green Party of Canada is eligible for a very generous tax credit. At tax time, you can get up to 75% back on the donation you make today.
Here's how it adds up:
YOUR DONATION Your Tax Credit WHAT YOU PAY
$20 $15 $5
$40 $30 $10
$100 $75 $25
$400 $300 $100
$1500 $650 $850
If you care about climate action, renewable energy, and First Nations rights, it's critical that Elizabeth May continue to lead those conversations on Parliament Hill.
Donate today: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks for your ongoing support,
Paul
Paul Gregory Director of Outreach Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 9 AM - 5 PM ET, MON-FRI IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: what’s missing?
message.text:
Michael, as the year winds down, we are at a critical deadline. I just talked to our fundraising department, and right now we're not quite meeting our targets.
BUT WE CAN GET THERE WITH YOUR HELP. WOULD YOU CONSIDER CHIPPING IN $ TODAY? DONATING IS QUICK, EASY, AND HAS A HUGE TAX CREDIT. [1]
Meeting our fundraising targets means a strong plan for 2017. It means we can continue to support Elizabeth May's fight against the Kinder Morgan pipeline and tanker expansion. It means we can grow our grassroots, as we inch closer to the 2019 election. It means having the resources we need to keep Green ideas on the front page, and in the hearts of Canadians.
Your donation of $10.00 could cost as little as $2.50 after the generous tax credit is applied. SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR A GREENER CANADA TODAY. [1]
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks so much,
CRAIG
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 12PM - 8PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
[2]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: you’re amazing
message.text:
Michael,
Wow, what an incredible response! You should see all the donations that our supporters are sending in. It makes me proud to be a part of this incredible Green movement.
We're only three days away from the New Year, and we still need to raise $135,000 to accomplish all of our goals in 2017.
We are so lucky to have supporters like you, who channel their generosity into political action.
A FEW DOLLARS HERE AND THERE ADDS UP TO BIG CHANGE. DONATE TO ENSURE WE HIT OUR TARGET BY MIDNIGHT ON SATURDAY. [1]
Your donation will keep us fighting on behalf of all Canadians in 2017.
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Cheers,
Bruce
BRUCE HYER DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 12pm ET - 8pm ET, every day until December 31st. If you don't get through right away, please call again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: wait, what?
message.text:
75% -- That's the tax credit you can receive for your donation today.
I have been watching the donations come in and we're so close to meeting our year-end fundraising goal.
, PLEASE DO YOUR PART TO HELP US HIT OUR TARGET. [1]
Money raised this week supports our operations year-round. It keeps us front-and-centre for debates on Canada's economy, environment, and democracy.
STEER CANADA TOWARDS A GREENER FUTURE AND DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Jeff
JEFF BRAUNSTEIN DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 12PM - 8PM ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: Here’s the truth, Michael
message.text:
Michael, I need to tell you a hard truth:
We can't afford to be apathetic when it comes to our climate. And we can't rely on the Liberal government to do what needs to be done.
That's where the Green Party of Canada comes in. In 2017, we want to continue speaking out about the Kinder Morgan and Energy East pipelines, major Liquefied Natural Gas projects, the Site C Dam, and what they mean for Canada's First Nations.
BUT WE CAN’T DO IT WITHOUT YOUR HELP. DONATE $ NOW. [1]
I know you care about building a more prosperous and sustainable future, and you know it's critical that Green ideas lead those discussions.
ENSURE THE GREEN PARTY IS STRONGER THAN EVER IN 2017 -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
[1]
Cheers,
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Remember, everything you give today is eligible for a tax credit of up to 75%.
P.P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 12pm ET - 8pm ET today and tomorrow. If you don't get through right away, please call again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: 1,000 days
message.text:
Michael,
I'm writing to you, because I know I can count on your support. I just heard from our accounting department -- and we are still under our year-end fundraising goal.
PLEASE PITCH IN AND HELP US MEET OUR GOAL: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Time and again, Green supporters like you have shown me their generosity.
The upcoming Federal election is just over 1,000 days away. In the meantime, I am not going to stop fighting for:
-- smart, effective climate action -- a fair democracy -- a future free from secretive trade deals -- and the rights of Canada's First Nations.
IF YOU SUPPORT THESE GREEN VALUES, DONATE $ NOW. [1]
Remember, everything you give today is eligible for a tax credit of up to 75%.
Wishing you and yours a Happy New Year,
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
P.S. If you would like to make a donation by phone, please call toll-free 1-866-868-3447, from 12pm - 8pm ET. If you have trouble getting through, please try again!
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])
Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: Canada getting sued?
message.text:
Michael -
I'm writing to tell you about an upcoming deadline that could steer Canada's economy for the next decade. Until January 27, the Canadian government is asking for your feedback on the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
HERE ARE SOME FACTS ABOUT THE TPP:
-- It allows corporations from 11 different countries to sue Canada whenever our government passes a law that hurts their profits. -- It allows these disputes to be settled in secret courts. -- It mandates that Canada pay huge sums of cash to corporations that win these disputes.
If you think that's ridiculous, you're right. It is called "Investor-State Dispute Settlement" (or ISDS) and under similar provisions in NAFTA, Canadian taxpayers have paid out millions to foreign companies.
, THERE’S TOO MUCH AT STAKE TO BE COMPLACENT. SPEAK OUT NOW AGAINST THE TPP. [1]
Don't bet on this issue going away just because President-Elect Trump opposes it. The TPP is far from dead. The US Congress still supports the deal, as does Trump's nominee for Secretary of State, ex-Exxon Mobil CEO, Rex Tillerson.
Trump has said he may try to renegotiate the deal, but we don't know what that's going to look like. Any TPP replacement will likely pose the same dangers to Canadians.
WE CAN’T STAND BACK AND LET THIS DEAL FLY THROUGH PARLIAMENT. STAND WITH US AGAINST THE TPP. [1]
Paul
PAUL MANLY INTERNATIONAL TRADE CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA SHADOW CABINET
[2] [3]

message.subject: back from the dead?
message.text:
Michael -
Trump isn't wasting any time. The new US President has approved the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines.
Remember Keystone XL? It's the pipeline Justin Trudeau wants to build, and will move bitumen and toxic solvents from Alberta to refineries in the US. President Obama had rejected it, but now, thanks to Trump, it's back from the dead. And Justin Trudeau's Cabinet has reaffirmed their support for the project, right on the heels of approving the Kinder Morgan and Line 3 pipelines.
IT’S UP TO US TO STOP THE KEYSTONE XL PIPELINE. TELL PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU AND NATURAL RESOURCES MINISTER JIM CARR THAT CANADIANS DON'T WANT ANOTHER EXPORT PIPELINE. [1]
Talk around the Keystone XL pipeline feeds into a big misconception: that a new pipeline will put unemployed Albertans back to work. That's not true.
Once Keystone is completed, any jobs created during construction will be exported to Illinois and Texas along with the bitumen.
With the price of oil as low as it has been in recent years, the economics behind building new pipelines just doesn't make sense. It leads to more oil sands expansion, and more greenhouse gas emissions. The Keystone XL pipeline isn't fair to Albertans and it isn't fair to Canadians determined to curb climate change.
HELP SEND A MESSAGE THAT CANADIANS WANT TO KEEP OUR PARIS AGREEMENT COMMITMENT. DEMAND THAT PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU REJECT THE KEYSTONE XL PIPELINE. [1]
Thanks for your support,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Betrayed
message.text:
Michael -
I feel more deeply shocked today by this government's actions than any other time in my adult life.
Thousands upon thousands of Canadians put faith in this Prime Minister's direct promise that 2015 would be the last election under first-past-the-post. He has broken that promise.
I never expected anything other than appalling decisions from Stephen Harper. But when you believe in someone and they let you down, that is much harder.
This cynical decision is designed to let the Liberals keep power for longer. But Justin Trudeau is about to learn that when you break people's faith, you will reap what you sow.
IT’S NOT TOO LATE. DEMAND THAT JUSTIN TRUDEAU REVERSE THIS DECISION, AND RECOMMIT TO KEEPING THE PROMISE HE MADE TO ALL CANADIANS. [1]
Despite spending millions of dollars on the issue, when our feminist PM didn't hear the answer he wanted, he threw his two young women ministers under the bus, and callously broke his word. This betrayal is one felt by all voters, volunteers, and activists who worked diligently to make this country's democracy fairer and stronger through meaningful electoral reform.
DEMAND THAT THE PRIME MINISTER REVERSE THIS TERRIBLE DECISION, AND LIVE UP TO HIS PROMISE TO CANADIANS. [1]
Thank you for your continued support. Canada needs it.
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

message.subject: without a paddle
message.text:
Dear Michael,
It's time to start undoing the harm Stephen Harper inflicted on Canada's lakes, rivers, and streams.
Over the Conservatives' ten years in power, Canadian waters -- from pristine salmon streams to cherished paddling routes -- were stripped of protections.The double-barrelled omnibus budget bills of 2012 - C-38 and C-45 - undid a century of environmental protections. The Fisheries Act was gutted, the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act repealed, and the Navigable Waters Protection Act left in ruins. The navigable waters act was brought in under our first Prime Minister, Sir John A. Macdonald. It protected Canadians' right to navigate any waters capable of being navigated, even seasonally by canoe.
After Harper was done with the law, no common sense definition of "navigable waters" remained. Instead, a list was added to the back of the bill, and if your lake or river was on the list, then it fell under the act. This effectively removed 99% of Canada's inland waters - lakes, rivers and streams - from any protection against obstructions from dams, bridges and even dumping of debris from blocking rights to navigation. Coupled with the repeal of the environmental assessment act, and bringing in a bogus sham of an EA act, thousands of projects were exempted from needing any permit or environmental assessment study at all.
HELP RESTORE PROTECTIONS TO 100% OF CANADA’S WATERWAYS. [1]
Even though the government changed in 2015, Stephen Harper's law for navigable waters remains.
THIS CAN'T STAND. DEMAND THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT RESTORE THE NAVIGABLE WATERS PROTECTION ACT. CLICK HERE TO EMAIL PRIME MINISTER JUSTIN TRUDEAU AND TRANSPORT MINISTER MARC GARNEAU. [1]
Thank you for standing up for our millions of inland lakes, waters and streams.
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: here's the deal
message.text:
Hi Michael,
Yesterday's equinox signals the start of spring, and with it comes our first fundraising deadline of the year. Like a family setting a household budget, every quarter we track how much we need to fundraise just to keep the lights on.
Ever since Stephen Harper killed the per vote subsidy, all of our work - for climate action, fair elections, and social justice - depends entirely on donations, month to month, from our supporters.
To keep up our work across Canada, we need to raise $56,000 by next Friday. PLEASE DONATE $ TODAY TO HELP US REACH OUR CRITICAL GOAL. [1]
I'm hoping we can totally eclipse our fundraising goals and give a real boost to these crucial projects:
- Redoubling our efforts to democratize Canada's voting system ahead of the 2019 election; - Investing in resources for the April 3rd by-election campaigns in Calgary, Montreal, Markham, and Ottawa; - Continuing to campaign against the Kinder Morgan, Keystone, and Energy East risky pipeline and tanker schemes.
CAN YOU PITCH IN $ TO HELP US BLOW PAST OUR FUNDRAISING GOAL OF $56,000? HERE’S THE LINK: [1]WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Green supporters are so generous, I know you will answer the call. Thanks again for keeping us on the forefront of change.
All the best,
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Burning dinosaurs
message.text:
Dear Michael -
Have you checked out the federal budget? The Liberals just released their spending priorities for 2017, and there's some good stuff in there. But there's a key area where the federal Liberals continue to fork over mega-bucks: oil and gas subsidies. This is puzzling, because during the 2015 election, the Liberals promised to "phase out subsidies to the fossil fuel industry".
LET’S NUDGE THE LIBERALS DOWN THE RIGHT PATH. DONATE NOW TO HELP US HOLD THEM TO ACCOUNT. [1]
While the numbers are murky, the federal government subsidizes the fossil fuel industry to the tune of $1.1 to 1.6 billion every year. No, that's not a typo. The federal government spends over $1,100,000,000 of public funds every year to subsidize fossil fuels, such as the oil sands and fracking.
These subsidies are blows to Canada's long-term climate goals, and make it impossible to meet the emissions targets set during the Paris climate conference. It's time to start transitioning our economy off carbon, not propping up oil and gas companies.
LET’S MAKE FOSSIL FUELS A THING OF THE PAST. HELP US KILL THIS DINOSAUR OF A POLICY BY DONATING NOW. [1]
Thank you for helping Canada move towards a Greener economy.
All the best,
Paul,
PAUL GREGORY OUTREACH DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Your donation will support our fantastic candidates in five by-elections on April 3. They're pushing our issues, making the dialogue more progressive, and keeping the other candidates honest. Donate today. [1]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Michael, check your record
message.text:
Dear Michael,
We are counting down the hours to our first fundraising deadline of the year. [1] Here's your record (based on this email address):
-- 2017 donation total: $ -- Donation needed today: $ -- Cost after tax credit: $
Our fundraising drive closes on Friday. So far, the support has been incredible. But we still have a long way to go to meet our targets.
PLEASE CHECK YOUR RECORD FOR 2017 AND CHIP IN $ TO PROPEL US TOWARDS OUR GOAL. [1]
Here's the link: GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Thank you for all that you do.
Jeff
JEFF BRAUNSTEIN DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. If you have recently donated online or via cheque, thank you! We are currently processing your generous donation, so it may not be reflected above. Likewise, if you recently changed your email address or you donate through your local Green Party riding association, your donation may not be included. We thank you again for your generosity.
