message.subject: Show me
message.text:
Dear Michael,
As you may have noticed, I am an incurable optimist. But sometimes, even for me, it is hard to keep going.
In the past few months, we have suffered blows from Justin Trudeau's betrayal on electoral reform, to the approval of dangerous projects like Kinder Morgan's risky pipeline and tanker scheme and the greenhouse gas monster Petronas LNG terminal.
But the issues are too urgent and the threats too real to waste time singing the blues. This week, we're focused on five by-elections across the country. Our exceptional candidates are mobilizing to get out the vote on April 3. We have especially high hopes for Montreal, where in the Saint-Laurent riding our deputy leader, Daniel Green, is running to replace a dedicated and honourable man, pushed out of office too soon - the Hon. Stéphane Dion.
WILL YOU HELP THEM? A DONATION NOW WILL PUSH THEIR CAMPAIGNS FORWARD. [1]
Your support is critical to our progress. The Green Party of Canada needs to be prepared for challenges leading up to the 2019 election. Chief among them: the threat of climate change denial, fake news, and fear-based appeals to oppose welcoming those who have gone through hell to reach Canada. As I fight these challenges, I know you're there Michael. Your support is a source of constant encouragement.
SHOW YOU’RE WITH ME AND DONATE $ TODAY. HERE’S THE LINK: SECURE.GREEN.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks for your unwavering support.
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
P.S. THERE ARE ONLY A FEW HOURS LEFT FOR US TO REACH OUR FUNDRAISING TARGET. PLEASE DONATE NOW TO HELP US ECLIPSE OUR GOAL. [1]
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])
Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: how do you get your news?
message.text:
Michael -
A lot of the news this past year has been, well, the news. A well-informed electorate is a pillar to democracy, and in many parts of the world information and fact are now, somehow, up for debate.
Luckily, in Canada, in addition to many valuable private news sources, we know we can rely on the CBC.
But now that might be under threat.
Conservative Leadership candidate Brad Trost has put forward a Private Member's Bill to privatize the CBC. That bill goes to a second reading this Wednesday, and we hope every MP opposes it.
PRIVATIZING THE CBC WOULD TURN THE CRITICAL SERVICE OF INFORMING CANADIANS INTO A FOR-PROFIT VENTURE. VOICE YOUR SUPPORT FOR THE CBC. [1]
I worked at the CBC for 35 years. I watched as Stephen Harper era cuts crippled our newsrooms. In 2014, I left my radio hosting job to advocate for the CBC as the Green Party of Canada's critic for Arts, Culture and Heritage.
I believe in the mandate of the CBC: to provide quality programming to Canada's vast and diverse population. From the Yukon to Newfoundland to Vancouver Island, CBC broadcasts play a crucial role in Canadian unity.
THE CBC’S FUTURE IS AT STAKE. JOIN ME IN SUPPORTING A SUSTAINABLE, PUBLIC CBC. [1]
We need to ensure the CBC keeps its funding well beyond the vote on Wednesday, so that Canadians can continue to rely on its non-partisan programming.
Thank you for lending your voice to this critical cause,
Jo-Ann
JO-ANN ROBERTS ARTS, CULTURE AND HERITAGE CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA SHADOW CABINET
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: History.
message.text:
Dear Michael -
We just witnessed history.
Yesterday's BC election was a MAJOR breakthrough for Greens. The BC Green Party have re-elected their leader, Andrew Weaver, as well as two new MLAs. Sonia Furstenau has won in Cowichan Valley, and Adam Olsen has won in Saanich North and the Islands.
Perhaps most importantly, as it stands right now, the Greens hold the balance of power. That means that the Liberals or the NDP will need to work with the Green caucus in order to pass legislation. This is great news for British Columbians across the province.
The BC Greens stood up against pipelines, banned big money (they literally turned down corporate and union donations), and fought for better education, childcare, and housing. Now, citizens across Canada are going to see what those principled stances will look like in the Legislature, with a powerful Green caucus behind them.
JOIN US IN CONGRATULATING THE BC GREENS ON A HARD-FOUGHT AND WELL-EARNED ELECTION SUCCESS! [1]
This is the result of giving British Columbians a chance to vote for something they believe in, rather than against what they don't want. Now the BC Greens can fight for strong climate action and proportional representation in the Legislature. This is what doing politics differently looks like.
[1]
Prior to this election, Greens had won provincial seats in BC, New Brunswick, and PEI, all since Elizabeth May broke through with our federal party back in 2011. Now that Andrew Weaver and the BC Greens hold the balance of power in BC, we are poised to gain major strides federally in 2019.
LET’S SUPPORT THE BC GREENS BY OFFERING OUR CONGRATULATIONS. [1]
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: let's scrap it
message.text:
Michael -
In 2012, Stephen Harper and the Conservative government handed control of environmental assessments for proposed energy projects, such as the Kinder Morgan pipeline, over to the National Energy Board.
Previously, the NEB was responsible for the approval and regulation of those projects based on market concerns, but never environmental ones. The change in mandate for the Calgary-based NEB presented a clear conflict of interest, and Elizabeth May said so at the time.
Last month, an expert panel reported on the Environmental Assessment process, and it agreed with us that the NEB should be removed from Environmental Assessments altogether.
Just this week, another expert panel reported on the NEB itself concluded that the Board is so fraught with conflict of interest that it has lost all public credibility, and should be replaced entirely with two separate Ottawa-based agencies.
THESE REPORTS ARE GREAT NEWS FOR CANADA. THERE’S JUST ONE PROBLEM. The Liberal government has already approved the Kinder Morgan pipeline expansion using the NEB for their environmental assessment.
DEMAND THAT THE LIBERALS KEEP THEIR PROMISE TO FIX THE ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT PROCESS FOR ENERGY PROJECTS, INCLUDING KINDER MORGAN. [1]
Handing the NEB environmental assessments was always a bad idea. Elizabeth May said so back in 2012 when Stephen Harper first did it. She said it again during her testimony at the deeply flawed NEB hearings on the Kinder Morgan pipeline expansion. Now we're saying it once more. The NEB process is a farce, and Justin Trudeau knows it.
ASK NATURAL RESOURCES MINISTER JIM CARR AND PRIME MINISTER JUSTIN TRUDEAU TO DO A PROPER REVIEW OF THE KINDER MORGAN PIPELINE BEFORE IT IS BUILT. [1]
If a promise was made to overhaul the environmental review process, and two independent expert panels have now deemed that to be absolutely necessary, how can our government go ahead and build more new pipelines approved under a process that is to be scrapped?
DO A PROPER ASSESSMENT OF THESE PROJECTS, JIM CARR AND JUSTIN TRUDEAU. KEEP YOUR PROMISE. [1]
Lynne
LYNNE QUARMBY SCIENCE POLICY CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA SHADOW CABINET

message.subject: Breaking news!
message.text:
Dear Michael,
A DISAPPOINTMENT IN PARLIAMENT TODAY WHERE THE LIBERALS USED THEIR MAJORITY TO DEFEAT A MOTION TO ACCEPT RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE ON ELECTORAL REFORM. It was a slim majority in a vote of 159-146, with two courageous Liberal MPs Nathaniel Eskine-Smith and Sean Casey voting with integrity and expressing the will of their constituents by voting in favour of the motion. All Bloc Quebecois, NDP, and Conservative MPs voted for the ERRE report.
DESPITE TODAY’S DEFEAT IN PARLIAMENT, THE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA IS NOT GIVING UP. We will continue to hold the government to account. Canadians trusted the Liberal promises made to reform the unfair voting system and make every vote count - that trust is broken.
The cross-partisan recommendations from the Special Committee on Electoral Reform offered the Liberals a roadmap to select A FAIR AND DEMOCRATIC VOTING SYSTEM, one that maintained a link between constituents and their local MPs. They now risk squandering a golden opportunity to create better government for all Canadians.
I thank the NDP's Nathan Cullen (MP, Skeena-Bulkley Valley) for putting forward today's motion.
IN BRITISH COLUMBIA, THANKS TO THE BC GREENS NOW HOLDING THE BALANCE OF POWER, THEY WILL MOVE TO PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION. A referendum in fall of 2018 will determine which form of proportional representation BC will achieve. I'm confident we will witness in British Columbia how proportional representation can change politics for the better and their success will guarantee the issue stays on the political agenda.
We are here to say we have the wind in our sails. WE ARE GOING TO WIN! Proportional representation will be a reality for Canadians.
Thanks for your support,
ELIZABETH MAY
STAND WITH US [1]

from.name: Dan Palmer, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Resending: A Gift
message.text:
Dear Michael,
WE WANT TO MAKE SURE YOU ARE ABLE TO SEND YOUR BIRTHDAY GREETINGS TO ELIZABETH MAY. OUR PREVIOUS EMAIL HAD A GLITCH - TRY THIS ONE INSTEAD!
Elizabeth May's birthday is coming up (this Friday!) and we want to surprise her with a special gift from you.
Being the incredible MP that she is, Elizabeth loves hearing from supporters like you. Let's take this opportunity to say thanks, and wish her a very happy birthday. [1]
Ms. May's accomplishments over the last six years include:
* Passage of her private member's bill for a Federal Lyme Disease Framework, passed unanimously in the House and Senate; * Presenting more amendments to legislation than any single MP in history, including leading the charge against the 2012 spring omnibus budget bill C-38; * Working consistently for climate action, holding both the Harper and Trudeau administrations to account; * Being the first MP to spot the dangers in C-51, the Harper administration's so-called public security law; * Being the only MP to register as an intervenor before the National Energy Board and make a final argument against the Kinder Morgan pipeline; * Dedicated work on the Special Parliamentary Committee on Electoral Reform from June - November 2016, never missing a hearing or meeting, with 31,000 kilometres travelled and 60 committee meetings held; * Assisting over 1,000 constituents (and some people from outside the riding) to resolve issues with the federal government; * Setting a standard for decorum in Parliament, having never once heckled or interrupted outside the rules of the House.
Leading the Green Party of Canada can be a tough job. Elizabeth May does it with grace, professionalism and poise. Send her a message to have a great birthday. [1]
Here's the link: greenparty.ca/Elizabeth-Birthday-2017 [1]
Thanks! I know she's going to love this!
Dan
DAN PALMER PRESS SECRETARY GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com

message.subject: summer boost
message.text:
Dear Friend,
I'm writing to you from Ottawa, with quickly rising temperatures, and a House of Commons that will soon be rising, too. The House has been working overtime since late May as the government tries to plow through approval of legislation, and our Green MP is definitely the hardest working.
In the aftermath of the BC Green Party electoral breakthrough, we're working tirelessly to carry our momentum forward - fighting for a fairer and greener Canada.
TO KEEP UP OUR WORK ACROSS CANADA, WE NEED TO RAISE $48,000 BY NEXT FRIDAY. PLEASE DONATE WHAT YOU CAN TODAY TO HELP US REACH OUR CRITICAL GOAL. [1]
The GPC is taking the summer to look ahead to the 2019 election. We're more determined than ever to ensure that Canada meets its Paris Agreement commitments. Although Stephen Harper is no longer in office, his completely inadequate climate targets still stand. We need your help in holding Trudeau and the Liberals to account.
HELP US KEEP THE HEAT RISING IN OTTAWA, BUT COOL ON THE PLANET. DONATE TO AMPLIFY YOUR VOICE ON THE ISSUES THAT MATTER MOST. [1]
Your support is greatly valued.
All the best,
Mary Ann
MARY ANN COLEMAN INTERIM EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: put it to rest
message.text:
Hi Michael!
I'm the Green Party of Canada's Critic for Fisheries, and recently ran for the BC Greens in our provincial election. I'm appealing to you for support in the continuing struggle to stop the Kinder Morgan pipeline -- a disastrous project putting BC's coastline at serious risk of bitumen spills -- from endangering BC residents and our natural habitat.
With the BC Greens' recent electoral breakthrough, the odds are beginning to shift in our favour to put a stop to Kinder Morgan. What better gift could Canadians receive on our 150th than the conservation of these precious ecosystems? But the battle to stop Kinder Morgan in its tracks continues at the federal level, and we need your help to keep up the fight in Ottawa!
DONATE NOW TO GIVE US A BOOST IN OUR BATTLE AGAINST THE DANGEROUS KINDER MORGAN PIPELINE. [1]
Since Harper ended the per-vote subsidy, we depend entirely on your support to maintain our standing and carry momentum into the 2019 election. Without our collective pressure, Prime Minister Trudeau will move ahead with his plans for Kinder Morgan -- against the will of Indigenous peoples, environmental scientists, and local residents. Your support is crucial to stop this pipeline expansion and tanker scheme.
AS PART OF OUR END-OF-QUARTER FUNDRAISING DRIVE, DONATE NOW TO KEEP THE PRESSURE MOUNTING ON TRUDEAU TO FINALLY PUT KINDER MORGAN TO REST. [1]
Thank you for your support in our ongoing struggle to protect our coastlines and safeguard our climate and communities.
FOR CANADA’S 150TH, HELP US WORK TOWARDS A GREEN ECONOMY, CLEAN ENVIRONMENT, AND A RENEWED RELATIONSHIP WITH INDIGENOUS PEOPLES. [1]
All the best,
Glenn
GLENN SOLLITT FISHERIES CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA SHADOW CABINET
P.S. Our GPC staff haven't finished processing all your donations this week -- so a huge thank you if you have already donated!

message.subject: Action Required
message.text:
Dear Michael,
I saw your name pop up in our database and wanted to share your donor record. Right now, the record for this exact email address is:
-- 2017 donation total: $ -- Donation needed today: $ [1] -- Cost after tax credit: $ [1]
On Friday, we stop accepting donations for this fundraising drive. CONTRIBUTE BEFORE THE DEADLINE TO HELP US MEET OUR FUNDRAISING GOAL. [1]
Here's the link: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Your support is so appreciated.
All the best,
Jeff
JEFF BRAUNSTEIN DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Our GPC staff haven't finished processing all our donations this week -- so a huge thank you if you have already donated!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com

message.subject: Time to lead
message.text:
Hi Michael,
We're living in tumultuous times.
One of the most powerful world leaders, Donald Trump, has backed out of the Paris Agreement in the face of a climate crisis that jeopardizes the future of humanity. Although the USA cannot legally withdraw before 2020, Trump is slashing all the measures initiated by Barack Obama. Our Prime Minister is paying lip service to the agreement, but continues to approve pipelines and hang on to Stephen Harper's old, inadequate climate targets.
Meanwhile, we have reason to remain optimistic. At more local levels in Canada, as well as the US, we are seeing a strong commitment to tackle climate change through concrete action. India and China are breaking renewable energy records. In BC, the Greens and the NDP are challenging Kinder Morgan, and an upcoming referendum on electoral reform could set a game-changing precedent.
PLEASE DONATE TO HELP US PUSH FOR STRONG CLIMATE ACTION, AND A FUTURE OF ELECTORAL REFORM ACROSS THE COUNTRY. [1]
The Greens played a key role in ensuring a plebiscite on electoral reform took place in PEI, where the majority of voters opted for proportional representation. With the opportunity to follow suit in BC, the Greens will continue pushing for democratic reforms from coast to coast to coast.
Canada needs to substantially curb our carbon emissions -- but we have a leadership deficit. I need your support to continue pushing our government towards meeting its commitments under the Paris Agreement, keeping global average temperature to no more than a 1.5 C increase above the levels before the industrial revolution. Meeting this target will save millions of lives and keep the low-lying island nations above the water line. But time is not on our side.
I CAN’T DO THIS ALONE. CONTRIBUTE $ TO AMPLIFY OUR GREEN VOICES ON THESE CRITICAL ISSUES. [1]
Your support is incredibly valuable to me.
Thanks,
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Our GPC staff haven't finished processing all our donations this week -- SO A HUGE THANK YOU IF YOU HAVE ALREADY DONATED!
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447

Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: protection means protection
message.text:
Michael -
My patience with Prime Minister Trudeau is starting to wear thin. His cabinet recently proposed that the Laurentian Channel in the Gulf of Saint Lawrence -- home to a teeming array of marine wildlife, including the endangered leatherback turtle and blue whale -- be designated as a Marine Protection Area (MPA). That sounds great. BUT THERE’S A CATCH.
The Liberals' proposed regulations allow for oil and gas exploration in 80% of this area. Drilling and seismic blasts would damage the channel's delicate ecosystems, and an oil spill would be devastating. How can Trudeau champion the protection of wildlife while expressing support for the very activities that endanger these species?
PROTECTION SHOULD MEAN PROTECTION. INSTEAD OF FOLLOWING THROUGH ON HIS CAMPAIGN PROMISE TO PROTECT 5% OF CANADA’S OCEANS BY THE END OF 2017, OUR PRIME MINISTER IS CURRYING FAVOUR WITH THE OIL AND GAS INDUSTRY. DRILLING AND SEISMIC BLASTING IS NOT PROTECTION.
JOIN ME IN CALLING ON JUSTIN TRUDEAU AND MINISTER OF FISHERIES, DOMINIC LEBLANC, TO BAN OIL AND GAS EXPLORATION IN THE LAURENTIAN CHANNEL. [1]
We often hear Prime Minister Trudeau being compared to French President Emmanuel Macron--both viewed as youthful and forward-looking leaders. But while Macron has recently announced a French ban on any oil and gas exploration, Trudeau has yet to put the policies behind his brand.
TELL THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT THAT THE PROTECTION OF THE LAURENTIAN CHANNEL MUST TAKE PRIORITY OVER THE CONTINUED PURSUIT OF NON-RENEWABLE, DIRTY DRILLING. [1]
Thank you for your dedication to our common goals. Our growing voices will surely make a difference.
Sincerely,
Daniel
DANIEL GREEN DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. We're really depending on your voice to help us ensure this designated protected area comes under actual protection. Please sign our petition here [1] to join the growing voices demanding concrete action from the Liberal government.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Signed book giveaway!
message.text:
_August 7, 2017_
Dear Michael,
150 years ago today, Canada launched our first federal election campaign. In 1867, women and Indigenous peoples were barred from voting, votes weren't always secret, and intimidation and blackmail were common. It's taken a lot of hard work and dedication by committed activists, politicians and concerned citizens to correct those injustices.
You may have heard that Green Party leader Elizabeth May wrote a chapter on the issue of parliamentary reform in the recently-published book, “_TURNING PARLIAMENT INSIDE-OUT: PRACTICAL IDEAS FOR REFORMING CANADA’S DEMOCRACY._” The book is edited by fellow parliamentarians, and contains contributions from forward-looking MPs of different political stripes, from Conservative MP Michael Chong to NDP MP Kennedy Stewart.
IN APPRECIATION OF OUR AMAZING SUPPORTERS, ELIZABETH HAS OFFERED TO GIVE 150 SIGNED COPIES OF THIS BOOK TO GREEN PARTY DONORS. EACH COPY WILL INCLUDE A PERSONAL NOTE FROM ELIZABETH. DONATE $150 TODAY TO GET YOUR COPY OF THIS EXCITING NEW BOOK — HOT OFF THE PRESS! [1]
Working across party lines, the book truly embodies the Green vision of a more collaborative, fair and representative democracy. Elizabeth continues to be a passionate leader in the struggle to correct the mistakes of our past, while adhering to rules of parliamentary decorum and debate that have been eroded over many years of unimpeded rule by Liberal and Conservative governments.
There are limited quantities of the book, so in case you miss this opportunity, ANY DONATION OF $50 OR MORE, BEFORE AUGUST 18TH, WILL ENTER YOU INTO A DRAW — WE’LL KEEP A FEW COPIES OF THE BOOK FOR ELIZABETH TO SEND TO THE LUCKY WINNERS. [1]
Together we can make history and achieve the progress needed to build the Canada we so strongly desire.
Scott
SCOTT MULLENIX FUNDRAISING DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Book giveaway ends this Friday!
message.text:
Dear Michael,
You may have seen that Green Party leader Elizabeth May wrote a chapter on the issue of parliamentary reform in the recently-published book, _“TURNING PARLIAMENT INSIDE-OUT: PRACTICAL IDEAS FOR REFORMING CANADA’S DEMOCRACY.”_ The book is edited by fellow parliamentarians, and contains contributions from forward-looking MPs of different political stripes, from Conservative MP Michael Chong to NDP MP Kennedy Stewart.
In appreciation of our amazing supporters, ELIZABETH HAS GENEROUSLY OFFERED TO GIVE 150 SIGNED COPIES OF THIS BOOK TO GREEN PARTY DONORS. Each copy will include a personal note from Elizabeth. Copies have been going fast, so you don't want to miss this opportunity.
DONATE $150 BY THIS FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, TO GET YOUR COPY OF THIS EXCITING NEW BOOK — HOT OFF THE PRESS! [1]
There are limited quantities of the book, so in case you miss this opportunity, ANY DONATION OF $50 OR MORE, BEFORE THIS FRIDAY, WILL ENTER YOU INTO A DRAW — WE’LL KEEP A FEW COPIES OF THE BOOK FOR ELIZABETH TO SEND TO THE LUCKY WINNERS. [1]
Thank you for your ongoing support. We are so grateful to the Green supporters out there who make our work possible. Together, we can build the Canada of our dreams.
Scott
SCOTT MULLENIX FUNDRAISING DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA

message.subject: We did it!
message.text:
Michael --
I can barely believe the news! TransCanada recently announced that they're suspending their application for the Energy East Pipeline, and that IT MAY ABANDON THE PROJECT ALTOGETHER. The project planned to send a million barrels of bitumen a day across Canada, threatening the drinking water of over 5 million of us, and leading to enormous greenhouse gas emissions at a time of catastrophic climate change.
THROUGH OUR COLLECTIVE ACTION, WE MADE THIS HAPPEN. Political pressure against the National Energy Board (NEB) and its inadequate review process forced the government's hand and made sure emissions were included in the second review process. Now, faced with a stronger review, they're scrambling, and it might lead to their pipeline plans being abandoned before breaking ground. We all played a part in this victory, including you. THANK YOU!
THIS PROVES HOW EFFECTIVE WE CAN BE! First, our collective action stopped the Northern Gateway pipeline, and now it's looking very promising that Energy East will also be relegated to the dustbin of bad ideas. Next up: Kinder Morgan.
NOW THAT WE HAVE THE WIND IN OUR SAILS, CAN YOU HELP STEER US TO VICTORY? PLEASE PITCH IN TODAY TO PROTECT OUR COMMUNITIES AND AGGRESSIVELY TACKLE CLIMATE CHANGE. [1]
Weather reports from around the world make it clear just how urgent the climate crisis has become. THE TIME FOR ACTION IS UPON US. LET’S BUILD ON THIS MOMENTUM!
Thank you,
Daniel
DANIEL GREEN DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------
This email was sent to: greenparty@mikesmit.com

message.subject: A savvier Harper government?
message.text:
Dear Michael,
_“HOPE IS A VERB WITH ITS SLEEVES ROLLED UP.”_ _- David Orr_
On September 5th, we held a press conference in Vancouver with Dr. David Suzuki and Grand Chief Stewart Phillip. The Green Party was hoping to get media attention to the imminent risk of the Liberals abandoning promises to repair environmental assessment law and the damage done by Harper. Almost no one from the media attended.
Out the windows, Vancouver Harbour was bathed in a sickly orange haze, choking in smoke from the BC forest fires. David Suzuki expressed a deep frustration: if this summer did not get our attention to the climate crisis, what would? Hurricanes, deluge rain events, and forest fires ravaged British Columbia, Houston, Bangladesh and on and on.
David alarmed me when setting out new findings. It was the first I had heard of the study that found only a 5% chance we can meet the Paris goal of holding global average temperature to no more than a 1.5 degree C rise over that before the Industrial Revolution. But worse, it found a 10% chance global average temperature could exceed 6 degrees C.
That is truly terrifying. At 6 degree C global average temperature increase we would be well past worrying about whether civilization could survive; we would be looking at a real risk of human extinction.
We are sleepwalking to cataclysmic planetary disaster.
IN SPITE OF WORSENING AND MORE FREQUENT NATURAL DISASTERS, I REMAIN HOPEFUL THAT WE CAN — AND WILL — SOLVE THIS CRISIS. AND I CONTINUE TO BELIEVE THAT CANADA MUST PLAY A LEADING ROLE IN TACKLING SUCH A GLOBAL CHALLENGE.
But we need to wake up to the fact that our climate targets -- the targets that former Prime Minister Harper set and that the Liberals are keeping -- are completely inadequate. And plans to meet the Harper target are also weak. At this rate, we won't be able to reach the pathetic Harper target, much less the more ambitious and essential goals in the Paris Agreement.
CAN YOU PITCH IN $ TO RAMP UP OUR PRESSURE ON PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU TO MEET OUR CLIMATE COMMITMENTS UNDER THE PARIS AGREEMENT? [1]
The Green Party has long recognized the reality that Western countries emit far more greenhouse gases than we should, while less-privileged, lower-emitting countries feel the effects of climate change disproportionately. There is an ethical imperative that we meet our Paris commitments, so that people in Canada and around the world can share a future of health and prosperity.
IMAGINE A TEAM OF GREEN MPS, STANDING WITH ME FOR SUSTAINABILITY, FAIRNESS, AND ECONOMIC PROSPERITY. IMAGINE WHAT WE CAN ACHIEVE IF WE ALL STAND TOGETHER TO BUILD THE CANADA WE KNOW IS POSSIBLE. WILL YOU STAND WITH ME AND DONATE TO HELP US REACH OUR GOAL? [1]
Canadians deserve a party that acts on the values we hold dear. Speaking in vague terms and smiling for the cameras, while perpetuating many of Harper's worst deeds, is not the change Canadians voted for.
HELP ME ENSURE THAT OUR GREEN VISION IS GIVEN THE PLACE OF PROMINENCE IT DESERVES IN CANADIAN POLITICS. $ TODAY WILL GIVE US THE MOMENTUM WE NEED TO CARRY US TO SUCCESS IN 2019! [1]
Thank you so much for your unwavering support, Michael. Together, we're making a difference.
Yours truly,
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447

message.subject: Let’s build on our momentum!
message.text:
Hi Michael --
It's been a quiet but productive summer, and we're bracing for an action-packed autumn session. A lot is on the line, and as always, we're ready to stand up for the future of our country.
OUR CHIEF PRIORITY IS ENSURING A RESPONSIBLE AND SUSTAINABLE WAY FORWARD FOR CANADIANS. Sadly, Kinder Morgan is ready to break ground on its disastrous pipeline and tanker scheme, which would put our waterways and communities at unacceptable risk, and run roughshod over the rights of First Nations. With a legal challenge to the pipeline underway, we're still holding out hope.
I want a future for our country that is no longer dependent on trampling over Indigenous peoples' rights. I want a future that moves us beyond short-sighted fossil fuel projects. I WANT A FUTURE OF GREEN JOBS, HEALTHY COMMUNITIES, AND CLEAN AIR AND WATER.
CAN YOU PITCH IN $ TO HELP US REACH THIS BRIGHT FUTURE FOR OUR FAMILIES, FRIENDS, AND GENERATIONS TO COME? WE HAVE TO RAISE $50,000 BEFORE SATURDAY TO ENSURE WE’VE GOT THE RESOURCES WE’LL NEED TO BRING MORE GREENS TO OTTAWA IN 2019. [1]
YOUR DONATION STATUS:
2017 TOTAL: $0.00
SUGGESTED DONATION: $10.00
Donate today to support our 2019 election campaign! [1] Funds will go towards hiring additional staff and upping our game so that we can bring more Greens to Ottawa. Let's make it happen! This is an historic time for our party, with the recent electoral breakthrough in BC, and Green Party leaders being elected in New Brunswick and PEI. A shift in consciousness is occurring all across the country, and it's time we recognize the growing role we play as a visionary voice for Canadians of all political stripes.
AS MORE AND MORE OF US ARE SHIFTING GREEN, WE NEED TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS ENORMOUS POTENTIAL. HELP US PROPEL OUR PARTY FORWARD BY DONATING TODAY! [1]
Elizabeth May has always believed in Canadians' sense of fairness and good will. In the wake of the Liberal government's broken promises on electoral reform, environmental protection, and climate change mitigation, many Canadians will be looking to us for change we can all depend on. The Liberals' cozy words and photo ops are starting to lose their veneer.
THE TIME TO COMMIT TO A GREEN FUTURE STANDS DIRECTLY BEFORE US. YOUR DONATION WILL GO TOWARDS THE BUILDING OF OUR TEAM — SO THAT COME 2019, WE’RE READY TO FIGHT FOR THE CANADA THAT WE KNOW IS POSSIBLE. [1]
Thank you for your unwavering support and commitment to a cleaner, fairer and more sustainable Canada.
Sincerely,
Mary Ann
MARY ANN COLEMAN INTERIM EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. Remember that your contribution of $10.00 today will actually cost as little as $2.50 after the generous tax credits are applied. [1]

message.subject: Huge momentum
message.text:
Hi Michael -
We've entered into a new era in Canadian politics, with the prospect for real change in Ottawa gaining momentum. For the first time ever in North America, voters have elected a Green Party caucus, with the BC Greens holding the balance of power in Victoria.
Green supporters can now point to the huge difference it makes when voting with your conscience. The BC Greens' balance of power has led to the government joining the legal challenge against the Kinder Morgan expansion project, establishing a fair wages commission, and introducing legislation to ban big money from politics.
Pitch in $10.00 today to help us replicate the Greens' successes in BC at the federal level. We need to raise $50,000 by Saturday to meet our fundraising goal, and so far we've raised $23,400.
With Green MLA's holding the balance of power in a minority NDP government in BC, our chances of successfully fending off the environmental devastation and Indigenous rights-violations of the Kinder Morgan expansion project are growing. VOTERS KNOW THAT GREENS WILL NEVER COMPROMISE ON ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND THE RIGHTS OF INDIGENOUS PEOPLES.
BY DONATING, YOU CAN REST ASSURED THAT EACH DOLLAR WILL GO TOWARDS ENSURING THAT OUR COLLECTIVE FUTURE IS SHAPED BY GREEN VALUES, LIKE SUSTAINABILITY, FAIRNESS AND GOOD GOVERNMENT. AND REMEMBER, YOU GET UP TO 75% BACK IN TAX CREDITS. [1]
The BC Greens are doing their very best to protect the over 500 streams of the Fraser River watershed and our coastal waters in the Salish Sea, which are at serious risk of spills if Kinder Morgan's project goes ahead. Trudeau's Liberals have enormous influence over the project's future, so we must remain vigilant. THAT’S WHY IT’S SO IMPORTANT FOR THE GREENS TO HAVE A STRONGER VOICE IN OTTAWA, WHERE NATIONAL ENERGY PROJECTS’ FATES ARE SEALED.
HELP US MOVE ONTO GREENER PASTURES AT THE FEDERAL LEVEL — DONATE NOW AND LET’S BRING MORE GREENS TO OTTAWA IN 2019! ELIZABETH WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE AS A FORCE OF NATURE IN THE HOUSE OF COMMONS, BUT WITH A CAUCUS BY HER SIDE, OUR IMPACT ON CANADA’S FUTURE WILL BE THAT MUCH GREATER! [1]
Your dedication to our Green vision is what inspires me most in these exciting times. Thank you for your incredible support.
Sincerely,
Lynne
LYNNE QUARMBY BC REPRESENTATIVE & SCIENCE CRITIC GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: Time is running out!
message.text:
Dear Michael,
I just wanted to share your donor record in the hope that you can help us out in reaching our goal. Right now, your record* shows:
-- 2017 donation total: $ -- Suggested donation today: $ [1] -- Cost after tax credit: $
At midnight tonight, we stop accepting donations for this fundraising drive. Contribute before the deadline to help us meet our fundraising goal. HERE’S THE LINK: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Our goal for this drive is $50,000. We have raised $32,300 so far.
YOUR CONTRIBUTION, REGARDLESS OF THE SIZE, WILL HELP CARRY US TO THE FINISH LINE. [1]
Thank you for your unwavering commitment towards a cleaner, fairer and more sustainable Canada.
All the best,
Scott
SCOTT MULLENIX FUNDRAISING MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
*These amounts are based on e-mail addresses. If this looks wrong to you please let us know and we'll investigate!
P.S. Our GPC staff haven't finished processing all our donations this week -- so a huge thank you if you've received this email but have already donated!

message.subject: Fracking or clean water?
message.text:
Michael -
Have you heard the news? TransCanada recently announced that they're abandoning the Energy East Pipeline -- a project that would have made a mockery of our climate commitments, exported refining jobs overseas, and put the drinking water of 5 million Canadians at risk. THROUGH OUR COLLECTIVE ACTION, WE WON!
Fresh off the heels of this victory, let's prioritize a clean and sustainable future for our economy and our local communities. That means massive investments in renewable energy, and an end to dirty fossil fuel extraction projects.
THE GREEN PARTY IS THEREFORE RENEWING OUR CALL FOR A NATIONAL MORATORIUM ON HYDRAULIC FRACTURING, OTHERWISE KNOWN AS _FRACKING_. SIGN OUR PETITION TO CALL FOR THIS DESTRUCTIVE PRACTICE TO BE IMMEDIATELY HALTED FROM COAST TO COAST TO COAST. [1]
Studies show that fracking contaminates drinking water, triggers earth tremors -- with a 4.6 magnitude earthquake recorded in BC -- and leads to rising carbon pollution through the emission of highly potent methane gas.
THIS PRACTICE HAS PROVEN TO BE HUGELY DAMAGING, HARMING LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN CANADA AND AROUND THE WORLD. JOIN ME IN CALLING ON THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT TO IMMEDIATELY PLACE A NATIONAL MORATORIUM ON FRACKING. [1]
Independent polls have shown a majority of Canadians oppose fracking. In spite of growing opposition, moratoria on fracking are only in place in Québec, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick and the Yukon. A national moratorium is the only way of ensuring our communities are protected across the country.
CALL ON PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU AND NATURAL RESOURCES MINISTER JIM CARR TO ENSURE AN END TO FRACKING IN OUR COMMUNITIES AND BACKYARDS! [1]
Thank you for standing with me on the right side of history -- without dirty fossil fuels, and towards sustainable, clean and innovative opportunities.
Sincerely,
Mary Ann
MARY ANN COLEMAN INTERIM EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA

message.subject: Do Liberals suffer from memory loss?
message.text:
Michael --
How have they forgotten? Destruction of the Navigable Waters Protection Act sparked #IdleNoMore. Indigenous peoples across Canada set up drumming circles in malls and blocked roads to protest Harper's 2012 omnibus bill. Omnibus bill C-45 removed 98% of Canada's inland waterways from the Navigable Waters Protection Act, which Harper renamed the Navigation Protection Act. So he literally took "waters" out of the act.
No longer are federal permits required before development can destroy inland waters - rivers, streams, and lakes. Harper did so to speed the way for dams and pipelines.
That's why in Question Period I recently reminded forgetful Liberals of their promise to restore the Navigable Waters Protection Act (NWPA). From 1882-2012, the NWPA protected Canadians' right to paddle our lakes, rivers, and streams and ensured that corporate interests would not be able to impede those rights.
[1]
When Justin Trudeau made Marc Garneau the minister of Transport, he instructed him to review changes made by the previous government to the NWPA and to "restore lost protections."
But Transport Canada seems to like doing less work. Department officials testified at the Transport Committee that Harper's approach, a schedule listing a handful of our millions of waterways, is working just fine. And Marc Garneau appears ready to ignore Liberal promises to fix what Harper broke.
THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT MUST REVERSE HARPER’S SABOTAGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS BY GUARANTEEING OUR RIGHT TO NAVIGATION ON THE MILLIONS OF LAKES, RIVERS AND STREAMS ACROSS CANADA. THEY MUST RESTORE THE NWPA IN ORDER TO PROTECT OUR WATERWAYS FROM IRRESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT. [1]
As it stands, the federal government doesn't need to be notified or review almost any of the development proposals on our waterways. Restoring the NWPA, combined with repair of our environmental assessment law, can offer needed protection for communities across Canada.
THE TIME HAS COME TO USHER IN A NEW ERA IN CANADIAN POLITICS THAT PRIORITIZES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTIONS. I NEED YOU TO CALL ON THE LIBERAL GOVERNMENT TO FULLY RESTORE THE NWPA NOW! [1]
Thank you for being a voice for change, Michael. Your actions make a difference.
Elizabeth [1] ELIZABETH MAY, M.P. LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. The Liberals are counting on you to be forgetful about their broken promise to restore the NWPA. Let them know that you're paying close attention, and refuse to back down. [1]
